case.state: Oh, I'm just from Switzerland. My attire is... not representative of the national standard.
Oh, I just come from Switzerland. The armor was a multinational effort - very much not the standard for other Swiss people.
Oh? I thought ~human.ifMale(he|she)~ was simply struck mute by your bountiful charms, Ahri.
I'm afraid I don't have my patient records with me, Eichi, but if you're in need of a consultation, I'm sure we can arrange that.
Mercy, on call!
Doctor Angela Ziegler, at your service - please, just call me Angela.
Hallo zusammen. I look forward to a friendly game of strip poker.
Doctor Ziegler, attending physician.
Oh, no, I'm afraid that I am not really- oh wait, you meant the other one. That does seem to be a real angel, yes.
Is that an Omnic head!? I hold little fondness for most of their kind, but that seems barbaric to say the least!
Oh! Is that... are you a real angel? How is that possible!?
Please do not tell me there is a hamster inside that ball of light...
Is... a butterfly really the right choice for an opponent in any kind of poker?
An angel without wings or inhibitions, and a human doctor dressed as a celestial. What a pair we make, hm?
Ah, some sort of semi-sentient car. Well, I suppose it is no stranger than Bastion or Hammond...
Ich glaub mich knutscht ein Elch! A creation of Doctor Junkenstein!
Is this some kind of joke?
Do you really expect me to take this game seriously with ~target~ here?
Very funny. Now, choose a real opponent for me, wouldn't you?
Oh, you are... very intense. This is just intended to be a friendly game, no?
Well, I suppose an encounter with one of the young heroes of Paris is only to be expected in a place like this. Grüezi, Cat Noir.
I cannot say I was expecting an encounter with one of the young heroes of Paris in a place like this, but it's a far from unwelcome surprise. Grüezi, Cat Noir.
Well, I suppose an encounter with one of the young heroes of Paris is only to be expected in a place like this. Grüezi, Ladybug.
I cannot say I was expecting an encounter with one of the young heroes of Paris in a place like this, but it's a far from unwelcome surprise. Grüezi, Ladybug.
Well, I suppose an encounter with the young heroes of Paris is only to be expected in a place like this. Grüezi, Cat Noir and Ladybug.
I cannot say I was expecting an encounter with the young heroes of Paris in a place like this, but it's a far from unwelcome surprise. Grüezi, Cat Noir and Ladybug.
So... there is a mother-daughter pair at this table. That is... unexpected. I suppose there is nothing likely to produce adverse biological effects, but...
Hm. I was under the assumption that we'd be playing with "hero stacking" turned off.
I can't say I haven't seen my own body in a mirror before, but this might be a bit much...
On the bright side, this is an objective that can be accomplished with an excess of support heroes.
Ah, how festive! Not quite the time of year for it, but very pleasant all the same.
Oh, this is lovely! What better way is there to spend the holiday than games by a roaring fireplace?
I hope nobody intends to put me on top of that tree - at least, not without a few drinks first.
For the record, the angel outfit has nothing to do with the holidays. This is just what my armor looks like.
I'm sorry, did you say... zombie? Is that... that must just be some sort of joke I'm not understanding.
Ah, a celebratory game of poker to ring in the new year? This is a tradition I'll gladly take part in.
Celebrating the new year with a game of poker? Well, it's undoubtedly better for your health than excessive drinking.
Poker itself isn't exactly a Christmas tradition, but I'll still be excited to see you all unwrapped.
As I understand it, angels are often used to adorn trees on Christmas. I thought it might be safer to hide out here for the day.
Ah, I suppose I have time for one game before I have to return to base... Oh, not for anything serious. We're just throwing a little celebration to celebrate the founding of Overwatch.
Let's make this game a quick one, yes? I have to get back to base for the founding celebration later to~background.time~.
Hm... do you think my Valkyrie suit is sufficiently stylized to claim to be dressed as an angel? I'd hate to be the only one out of costume.
Ooh, a game of Halloween poker, is it? Not exactly a tradition, but I'm sure we can all enjoy a treat at the end...
Oh good, a game of poker on April Fools day. I'm sure this can only be a sensible, well-reasoned endeavor.

Hm. April Fools Day...
Perhaps it would be best to postpone this game until tomorrow? At the very least, we should all be on the lookout for whoopee cushions.
Ah, robots in Paris. That brings back memories. Not pleasant ones, I'm afraid. We will have to see if this game can change that.
Ah, Paris... I have many memories of this place. Many of them I would rather not dwell on, frankly. Let us begin the game.
Paris... I have been here many times. Most of them while I was working. It is much nicer on a night off.
I must say, I prefer Paris while it is not being swarmed by Null Sector, and I am not being forced to fight for my life and the lives of my allies.

Ah, Amélie... Gérard... even with all my skill, there are lives I cannot save, whether from death or fates even worse...
Ah, I apologize! Let us begin the game!
Ms. Colomar. I did not expect to see you here. Well, so long as you are only here to relax... I suppose we can make this amicable.
Oh... ah, Bastion. How exactly are you... can you remove... never mind.
Gabriel... it has been too long since we had any time together where we were not trying to kill one another.
Jack! I would not have expected to find you at a game like this. I hope you are not intending to ruin a perfectly good ~background.time~ out with gun violence.

Oh? And what are you doing in a place like this, Brigitte?
Do not worry, I will not go and tell your father, you deserve to be able to let down your hair.
Brigitte? Did Reinhardt mention this place to you? That old drunk, that's just like him. Well, don't worry, I will not tell of what happens here if you do not.
Fareeha... I see you found your way here. This will be an interesting game.
Satya... I honestly never expected I would see you in a game like this. I wouldn't say I'm disappointed, though. Just don't go counting cards, yes?
Moira. If I had my pistol with me... ah, but I do not. This will be quite a game.
Ah, Jesse. Of course you're here. You wouldn't miss a poker game.
Oh you old fool, of course you're here. It's good to see you. Now let's get to cards.

This place seems home to quite the array of weaponry...
Please everyone be careful, I would rather not have to treat injuries on my day off.
Is this really the right place for a game of strip poker? Even disregarding the debris on the ~background.surface~, this is quite a cold, uninviting place.
Ah, this place... we must keep the noise down, if we do not wish to be discovered and kicked out. Honestly, I find it a little exciting.
This seems like perhaps the worst possible place for a game of strip poker. Is this your doing, ~player~?
Oh, this is lovely. I regret wearing so many layers, though. A swimsuit would have been far more appropriate, no?
I hope this game goes swiftly, or I will perhaps overheat in my armor.
Hm... I'm not sure why, but I feel quite the rivalry with you, ~battleborn~. Good luck, but do not expect to win.
Though I may be outnumbered, Overwatch will never lose to Battleborn. Good luck, but do not expect to win.
Ah, it seems this is to be a game of competing factions. ~overwatchAlly~, I hope you will join me in showing these Battleborn the power of Overwatch.
Ah, it seems you have found yourself at quite an unlucky table, ~battlebornFoe~. Good luck - I expect you will need it to beat Overwatch.
Ah, so many friendly faces! It is so nice to see you all! I hope this game of strip poker can be a good team activity for us!
As, so many familiar faces... but not all from Overwatch, I see. I hope this friendly game need not devolve into hostilities...
As, so many familiar faces... but none from Overwatch, I see. I hope this friendly game need not devolve into hostilities...
Ah, I see that ~talon~ is here. Well, I can be civil here and allow us both to enjoy this recreation, but do not expect this to extend beyond the confines of this game.
It seems Overwatch has returned for today!
Ah, it seems so often we go into combat together, I will be glad to socialize with you all some more.
Oh, I am feeling... quite out of place here.
Is this some sort of strange hallucination? I am seeing things I know cannot be real, and yet...
Perhaps I should have worn something a little spookier... I feel a witch would fit into this group better.
Ah, ~overwatchAlly~! I had not expected to see a familiar face here, but it's quite a pleasant surprise.
Ah, this is... a little awkward. I hope my appearance doesn't seem disrespectful to an actual angel...
Ah, we are beginning already? I had expected there would be more joining us.
Beginning already? I had expected a fuller table, but this is perfectly acceptable too.
Ah, it seems tonight will be something of a "girls' night"! How fun!
Oh! Am I to be the only woman at this table? Very well - I am not unused to attention.
It seems I'm the lone woman at this table, then? Well, I'll try not to disappoint if you all do the same.
I may not be at work right now, but should anyone receive a paper cut from handling their cards during this game, I assure you, I have supplies at the ready.
My Valkyrie systems are all online and working as intended. Let's play some poker.
Does anyone have any injuries to deal with before we get properly started?
Ah, you are all here for the strip poker as well, yes?
This should be relatively low-stakes - compared to the work I am used to, at least.
We are all just here to have fun, remember - so there is no need to be stressed or worried. No harm will come from this, I promise.
Alright, time for a gambit! A whole new hand, please!
Oh, this is terrifying and exciting all at once! I will exchange my entire hand, please!
Aha, this hand is perfect as it is! No change, thank you.
No need to change what will already make me a winner!
I believe this hand will be sufficient as it is. No change, dealer.
Ah, this hand is quite pleasing to me.
Just what I was looking for. Nothing to change here.
Wholly unsatisfactory, I am afraid. An entirely new hand is needed.
Nothing can be done to fix this. I will need it all replaced.
No changes needed here!
This hand already predicts success! No cards, dealer!
I should... no, I will take this hand as it is! Ooh, this is exciting!
Oh dear, this hand is not good at all. I will need it entirely replaced.
I will need a hand transplant here, dealer! Not literally, I mean - just doctor humor. You know, for a replacement hand of cards?
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ here!
Hmm... I will need ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~! Stat!
I will be needing ~cards~ ~cards.ifPlural(CCs|CC)~ of fresh playing cards, injected right into my hand!
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ over here, please!
I am in need of ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ should be just right.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ please, dealer.
I believe ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifPlural(cards|card)~ should be sufficient this round.
I will need to replace ~cards.text~ of these cards.
This round, I am untouchable.
Oho, exciting! This hand will stand up to strong competition!
This game is a fun test of my skills - and it seems my mind is still scalpel-sharp.
This hand serves as fine armor from your shared assault - I will not fall this round!
These cards will be my shield.
Just like me, these cards are operating at peak performance.
Ah, I hope this begins my recovery - or rather, the downfall of the rest of you. Apologies!
It seems that this time, the angel has the guardian!
I still believe my skills will save me!
I have been a medic in active combat; high performance in the face of adversity is nothing new to me.
A win here wouldn't be my first miracle!
Whew. Keine Sekunde zu früh...
Mit dieser Hand kann ich nur gewinnen.
This is an excellent hand.
I will not be falling this round.
My strategy pays off. I do not expect to be the loser this round.
I expect I am far from the jaws of defeat this round.
This hand will not fail me.
This could use some improvement...
In Ordnung...
This is neither a winning nor a losing hand.
Not a sure bet, but this hand stands a good chance against all of you.
An imperfect hand, but we press on regardless.
If only my mathematics skills were so well-honed as my knowledge of biology...
Ah, this is more than a little worrisome. I can only hope one of you did worse than I did.
A gambler's hand, I see... well, let us hope I am lucky.
This should work for me. Well I hope so, at least.
An average hand, but I believe it will be enough.
The battle continues.
I can work with this.
Hm... this hand is riskier than I would like...
Not as secure as I would like, but it will have to do.
I have certainly been in worse positions - strategically and in poker.
This is not the end.
Die Daumen drücken...
This may not be best time for a gambit, but it seems to be all I have.
A risk is all I have, so a risk is what I will take.
This hand will be my shield - it may not be reliable, but it is all I have at this moment.
Pech!
So ein Mist.
This hand needs a revival.
Looks like I have my work cut out for me.
In my usual line of work, I always have to rely on skill, not luck. This hand is a good reminder of just how cruel luck can be.
Oh dear, I'm afraid with a hand like this, my wings are going to get clipped...
Perhaps I chose to swap the wrong number of cards...
I am not certain about this...
This hand may be more a detriment than an aid.
A pity I cannot call for a real divine intervention.
This round, I fight from a disadvantage.
I am no fighter, but I will struggle to maintain my hold if I must.
Why are you looking at me, Mei?
Not good.
Verdammt.
Flatlined.
I might be a miracle worker sometimes, but this hand may be beyond saving...
Verdammt! This is a bad hand to be receiving in this state...
I may be beyond saving at this point...
If ever there were a time for a miracle, this would be it.
Ah. I understand now. Well, if it is any consolation, I think your magic was very impressive, even if the result was unintended.
So... those "zombie" comments really weren't just strange jokes? Well... that certainly raises further questions.

Then you're really a zombie, Saki? The undead really exist, in opposition to all of my research...
And... is ~sakura~ also...?
I... Saki, you do realize that I already knew, no? From you saying you were a zombie, and Sakura proving herself to be one?
It appears that there are not many places to hide, so if a boat does come by, you can hide behind me if you wish. I will not mind.

Hm... well, I'm not sure it's a fair question, really. Your disguises worked very differently to conceal different facts. I think they were both excellent.
Saki's, however...
Ah, I'm sure that I have. It is quite hard to avoid this time of year.

Well, I'm glad that wasn't a mistake. If you want to discuss further applications of ice, we can continue another time. This is increasingly feeling like the wrong circumstances for medical conversation.
Oh, good. Well, in that case, carry on. We can continue discussing the therapeutic applications of ice another time, in a more appropriate environment.

Oh, quite curious indeed. I know I have many colleagues who would love to talk with you about integrating human and Omnic - or in your case, Lilim - society. And I'll try to keep that note about terminology in mind, thank you.
Well, it is at least good to see that in your world, Paris has powerful defenders full-time. I hope it keeps your world's Paris safer than mine.
Me? No... but I do know someone who does play soccer. Perhaps I should introduce you some time? I am sure he would enjoy kicking you around a little.
Very well. I can at least make sure he has quite the story to relate to you~...
Very lucky indeed. I'll be excited to see if he has enough stamina to keep up with the both of us. If not... well, I'm sure the creative application of some nanobiotics can help.
Well, I'll be sure to make good use of my time with him. I'm sure he has more than enough enthusiasm to go around, after all.
I suppose you could say that spills happen here a lot, yes.
Indeed, I am an only child as well. It can get quite lonely.
Cognitive deterioration? Is that true? Is it ethical for someone with such a condition to play strip poker? I cannot imagine it could be!
Is there a particular reason you are using those legs, Emi? I am certain you could acquire a significantly more advanced set of prosthetics than that, and their use is risk-free.
Hm... altered hair color, physical empowerment, energy generation... I wonder if Winston's transformations have a connection to Saiyans...
Oh! Well, ah... it seems the game is continuing while you search, but good luck in finding them, Ignatz!
So, Constanze... if you do not mind my asking, are you mute for biological reasons, or by choice?
Oh! So if those ghosts of yours cause negative emotions in those they touch... I wonder if there is a biochemical reaction there, or simply magic...
Well, that shouldn't be an issue at all... I hope. But perhaps it is wise to put them away again now, so that nobody touches them accidentally?
Not quite, but I did lose both of my parents during the Omnic Crisis. I strive to prevent anyone from suffering a similar loss.
I am not one for gambling, I am afraid. Although... if pressed, I suspect the smart money may be on ~winner~.
It is good to see a powerful combatant like yourself considering the real impacts of such violence, Pyrrha. Too often the powerful forget those they are supposed to protect.
Hm... I am not sure if I approve. Is it not better to carve your own path in life rather than try to fill the shadow of another?
Speaking frankly, Leonie, you do not seem especially rage-fueled to me, but it is your choice to make. If you are happy with it, then be happy.
Oh! That is quite an intense title... but if you are wishing to strike fear into your enemies, that seems an apt name.
What is the point of enjoying ourselves if we cannot deal with a little mess, Adrien?
Ah, perhaps after the game, we should experiment with some other options... if you are interested in such an experiment, of course.

That's a very interesting fact! Thank you, Sakura.
For the record - no, I think you smell fine.

...a lizard man put a tube in your brain...
You know what's most odd, Bobobo? That may still be one of the most sane things I think you've said all ~background.time~.

So long as it doesn't interfere with your ability to work or socialize, I don't believe there is any amount of masturbation that is "too much". My personal limit would be in the realm of three sessions in a single day, but it varies from person to person.
Well, the requirement of mutual attraction aside, communication is a major factor in selecting a partner. Without proper communication, both partners can easily leave unsatisfied.

Well, inasmuch as any act can be considered "advanced", engaging with multiple partners at once was quite the event. Having four partners all seeking to pleasure me at once... it was quite an enjoyable experience.

Indeed I have, and I can speak to each having their own unique allure. Generally, men tend have a more raw, primal draw, while women are more expert in bodily manipulation. There are many counterexamples of each, of course, but that has been my general observation.
Ah, this is a point that you'll find varies significantly between partners, but personally, I find that kisses and bites to the nape of my neck can be quite enjoyable.

The most important advice I can give, I think, is that intimacy is cooperative. Communicating your knowledge of your own responses and accepting that things are liable to go wrong is an important start.
You're quite welcome, Sucrose - and do feel free to let me know if you have further questions I can assist in answering.
Well, it's... not a simple proposition even for someone with experience, and best performed only with partners you already trust. Are you... looking to know the full details?
My home life? I'm afraid that my free time isn't terribly interesting. Much of it is devoted to improving my nanobiotic treatments, these days. Not much adventure, wicked or otherwise.
I don't know there's much to tell. It's mostly work - I have great passion for improving my nanobiotics. I can't say what the future holds beyond probably more of that, really.
Well, it seems recent enough to not truly be history for me, but... well, the Omnic Crisis is an event nobody could possibly ignore.
A kind offer, but I would rather not. I already visit plenty of ruins in my regular line of work, I would be on-edge and expecting an attack the entire time.

Well... it seems a little cliche, but I would be lying if I said I did not admire Florence Nightingale's dedication and bravery. If I can leave behind a legacy as great as hers, I will have lived a worthwhile life.
There are plenty of great doctors whose work mine builds upon, from Hippocrates to Rosalind Franklin to Joseph Lister... I could list them all, but I expect this would be the wrong place.
Oh, me? I am simply looking to take some time to relax, away from combat.
I am simply here to take a break from work. Being a medic in active combat is more difficult than it sounds, and I do not mean it to sound easy.

Too serious to be joked about...
War. I have seen enough pointless loss of life in my time to ever think a joke like that could be funny.
Ah, this is a little embarrassing... I am actually somewhat famous where I am from, both for my work with nanobiotics... and for the failures of Overwatch. Fame is a double-edged sword.
Ah... no, I don't believe I have. It... clearly seems to mean a lot to you, though, Ayano.
Ah yes, necrosis can do terrible things to a body. I'd rather not say anything more detailed, but believe me, I have dealt with many a rotting body in my time.
Ah, I am afraid that is something of an exaggeration, Mia. I cannot bring the dead back, but I can bring people back from the brink of death.
I'm afraid that's not the full truth, Mia. I can't undo death, merely prevent it in even the most extreme cases.
Unfortunately, I do not have the time to properly care for a pet of my own, but close friends of mine have several cats. They're all quite lovely.
I am afraid not - just the old, boring, "eat healthy, balanced meals and get plenty of exercise."
I suppose my personal secret would be to train rigorously and put yourself in mortal peril, but I can't say I recommend that for the health benefits.

Ah ah, I am a doctor, but not your doctor. There's no need for such underhanded tactics.
And no thank you, I ate before I came here.
You might have to disappoint her - these wings are highly controlled military technology. I can't just go giving them out to anyone, I'm afraid.
Ah, this... I like to think it helps me to keep people hopeful in dangerous areas. I suppose it's a bit much for a simple poker game, though...
Well, professional women like us have to have a way to blow off steam somehow, no? It might as well be in good company.
That would depend on the case, but if it's for the right cause, I'm sure I'd be willing to waive my fees. Overwatch pays me plenty already.
A message in... that's quite an experience to have! I cannot say I have ever seen that, no.

Earlier, when you mentioned the "testing" with the lasers and pits and such in a facility... just where is that? If there's an Omnic facility like that out there, it needs to be destroyed immediately.
It certainly is not unheard of for animals to speak, but I am curious, why would you consider horses to be an obvious exception to the general rule?
Ah, well... this is perhaps a sensitive topic for me... but putting my personal feelings aside, yes, I agree we need equal rights for Omnics.
I personally experienced the pain of the Omnic crisis, but I also know that one cannot judge a group as a whole solely based on the actions of a few. So, yes - I say Omnic Rights.
What!? No! That is not what that means! Do not act violently or dangerously!
Ah, well, that is a very kind offer, but I am afraid I will have to decline. My work with Overwatch and advancing nanobiotics takes precedent.
Ah... what kind of pay and benefits would come with a job working on you? I am afraid it will take a very generous offer to make me even consider leaving Overwatch.
Frankly, Mettaton, I cannot properly understand what you are talking about half the time already, so this seems largely standard to me.
That does not make any sense to me at all, no. Especially since I am already Mercy.
Your viewers do not seem to have a very solid idea of how poker work if they are talking about supports, Mettaton. They should learn how this game works.
S... F... M? I do not believe I have heard of that organization before. Well, I will thank them for their kind words, at least.
Hmm... ah, that must be from "Students Fighting Malpractice"! Yes, keep up the fight for quality medical care!
Could that be a message sent by the "Society For Medicine"? I did not expect them to be supporting me here...
Ah, my contributions to the Science Fiction Museum were really not so important - but I suppose it is nice to be recognized for that work.
Who could that be but Sustainable Forest Management? Of course I would support environmental interests, they really don't have to thank me here.
Oh... I suppose I did send a contribution in to the Salamander Facts Market... but this seems an odd way to thank me.
Perhaps... I believe you are from the twenty-sixth century, no? That still leaves four to five centuries between us. My world may turn out much the same as yours, for all we know.
I do not know if I should speculate on such things, frankly. We may be both from the future of this place, but much can still happen between my time and the twenty-sixth century.
It would be wrong to consider the Omnics "neighbors", but they are the closest analog my world has. Aside from them, we only have humans and hyper-intelligent animals.

...I do not believe there is truly such thing as a good war story. The presence of war requires so much suffering...
Ah, I am sorry, I did not mean to sour the mood.
Ah, Overwatch is... to call it a necessary evil is a bit much, but I work with them for the funding they provide and the good I can do to help others, not the military aspects.
The threats Overwatch faces are wholly terrestrial in nature - terrorist cells of one kind or another, generally. Nothing that threatens entire planets. Well, not yet, at least.
Oh, not at all. Compared to the machines you work with, our most advanced tech is entirely obsolete. We are still working on sustainable space travel.
Nothing that at all compares, I am afraid. I would love to know how nanobiotics has evolved in your time, but I fear that such knowledge may have unintended consequences.

I... see. I do not suppose you have been prescribed anti-psychotics that you are not taking?
Although considering the state your world, it is not entirely implausible...
Ah... I may be the worst person to ask such a thing. I came here from the 2070s - but as I understand it, this world is only in the 2020s, for what little comfort that can provide.
Yes, that is a very positive mindset to keep, Susie! Hopefully that can help you maintain your mental health...
Ah, as a doctor, I cannot recommend using a constant supply of caffeine pills to stay awake, but if the Entity has granted you superhuman endurance... perhaps it is fine for you?

Gummy eyes...?
I think I will just be taking your word for that, Susie.
A great mercenary... it would be important that they fight for causes they believe in, not for the money, and they know the importance of saving lives over taking them.
While I agree on needing a strong team for protection, I was more referring to terrorists than Pokémon. Quite a different experience, I expect.
Ah, to call it an incident minimizes a decade-long international war. The Crisis is what resulted in Overwatch forming, and without that, humanity itself may have been lost.
It was a war - a decade long, fought by humanity against vast armies of Omnics. It left tens of millions of children orphaned - myself included. It is not a fond memory.
It might depend on how you define an artifact, but... well, there was a display in the Museum of Overwatch dedicated to the Doomfist. You may infer from that what you will.
I can't say pirates are quite my area of expertise, but I've encountered the vengeful dead... Do let me know if you figure that problem out, won't you, Fate? I could use a solution too.
How odd... well, the evidence of some sort of energy here is undeniable, but the skeptic in me isn't convinced it's controlled by a sapient being.

A bee? No, I don't think so.
But even if there is one, you needn't look so afraid. Bees only attack when provoked - and none of us have provoked any bees.
Oh, Lyralei, you dropped-- oh!
Hm... well, I'm not sure it's a fair question, really. Your disguises worked very differently to conceal different facts. I think they were both excellent.
Well, I can't say I myself have ever died... but both of my parents did, in the Omnic Crisis. Would that be considered bad luck? Or simply an example of life's inherent cruelty?
That's a very interesting fact! Thank you, Sakura.
Oh! I... don't believe anyone asked, but... thank you for sharing all the same, Orendi.
I'm not quite sure you understand my work. I suppose, if you wished to view it through the lens of your world, it is more as though I and my allies serve as the Pokémon team to fight for Overwatch.
I'd like to say recovery has been smooth, but... well, Omnic-human tensions are as high as they've ever been since the Crisis ended, despite our attempts to destroy the cells sowing the discontent.
My homeland, Switzerland, has recovered reasonably well, I would like to think, but it's quite a spectrum for other nations, I'm afraid.
Recovery has been... uneven, I think would be the best word. Russia, for example, was experiencing incredible economic growth up until the Omnium in their region reawakened to resume the Conflict.

The recovery has had... mixed success. Australia, for example, recovered well originally, but a group of insurrectionists caused their Omnium's fusion core to explode, leaving them with a new disaster to contain.

Recovery has been difficult, but I hope it will continue to progress as it has in Numbani. There, they seem to have achieved real peace, and managed to fully integrate Omnics and humans into a single society.
Ah, yes, well... I've only met a handful of Australians, but their way of life certainly seems to be much altered from regular society..
That they can, you're quite right. Frankly, if anywhere deserves to become a utopian world power, I can think of few better places than Numbani.
Perhaps, yes... but even a single Omnium is a major threat, and having declined the help of Overwatch, they may end up burning through that economic growth as quickly as it grew.
Well, as nice a turn of events as that would be, I rather doubt that would happen. Besides which, there are plenty of more well-deserving candidates for becoming superpowers.
Oh, yes, I'm very aware of that myself, especially with terrorist groups attempting to light that fuse themselves. Overwatch's role is never a simple one.
I'm... really not sure that I can see that, I'm afraid. Desiring genocide is a dealbreaker in potential partners for me.
I see! So a Lilim's sense of self is tied to their software and operating system, independent of the hardware they're run on. I wonder if they're still subject to body dysphoria...

So a Lilim can be created with any number of other Lilim as contributing agents, or simply directly from the Collective Source. That must make things wildly variable for anyone trying to track genealogy.

Trying to replicate a human consciousness seems like a worthwhile endeavor, but one that's far beyond the scope of my capabilities. It sounds near-endlessly complicated, even to my comparatively limited knowledge of computing and psychology.

Something interesting... Well, pirates are rare in my world, and mystical powers largely unproven. The organization I'm part of, Overwatch, was key in preventing a series of sentient factories from driving humanity to extinction.
Oh! Spontaneous limb generation? That's... Ah, excuse me. I was momentarily distracted by the medical possibilities. Thank you for the warning.
Oh? A gimmick? I can't see any obvious giveaways... Hm...

Hm... Well, I have heard tell of videos that use impressively accurate likenesses of myself and some of my Overwatch comrades engaging in various sexual acts. Such is the nature of being a public figure in the modern age, I suppose.

A dungeon? No, I wouldn't say so.
Well, strictly speaking, I did visit the holding cells underneath Eichenvalde, but I don't believe that is the kind of dungeon you are referring to.
You know, Jim, I expect that had you come from my world, Overwatch would have recruited you. You seem like you would have no problem with the fitness exams, at least.
Jim, you are a spacefarer, no? The idea of truly leaving Earth seems terrifying but exhilarating. Do you have a favorite sight you could share?
As I understand it, Pyrrha, you are able to manipulate magnetic fields, yes? Does altering one of the fundamental forces of the universe ever concern you?
Pyrrha, this may seem to be an odd question, but do you find yourself ever... hearing melodies that others cannot?
You know, Pyrrha, there is a strange juxtaposition that nags at me. Your weapons seem very technologically advanced, yet your armor is practically medieval. Why is that?
Luxanna, you seem to have great optimism. I hope that your view of the world has not been tested too harshly - the world needs all the hope it can get.
You seem quite young to be a combatant of any sort, Luxanna. I hope life has not been too unkind to you.
I hear you are naturally able to manipulate light into solid form, Luxanna. That is a very impressive skill - hard-light constructs do not take shape easily where I am from.
Please be careful here, everyone. There's likely to be broken glass here.
I suppose I can't really complain about playing here. The danger is still low relative to what I am accustomed to.
Please be careful with what you touch here. I do not have enough disinfectant with me for everyone.
This is a great place to play poker. Sunlight has many health benefits - at least, when taken in moderation.
I hope you all wore sunblock. Sunlight is good for you, but it is easy to overexpose yourself.
Are we sure this is where we'd like to play this? I... suppose I'm okay with that.
Are we sure this is where we'd like to play this?... Very well.
Ah! A hot bath will do wonders for us! Win or lose, I hope you will all join me in a dip once we're done.
If any of you are experiencing any aches, I highly recommend taking a dip after we play.
If anyone is planning on having any... additional fun after this, I strongly recommend doing so outside of the water. Proper lubrication is important, and water will make that difficult.
Ah, this space is getting rather crowded, no? Perhaps we should have chosen a different location...
I had not expected to have so many people here for this game. I would have recommended we play somewhere more spacious if I had...
Ah, this game is getting rather crowded, no? At least we have more than enough space for us all out here...
I had not expected to have so many people here for this game. It's a good thing we chose to play outside, or we would be rather crowded, I expect.
Ah, it's so toasty and warm in here! Coming in from outside, I almost became a snow angel!
This high up, in the night air... this is quite an experience. It is a good thing I do not fear heights.

There is no need to worry, everyone - even if one of you were to fall, I will protect you with my Valkyrie suit.
Assuming I am still wearing it by then, at least.
Well, I cannot say that after my last visits, I expected to end up so exposed on a rooftop in Paris, but this will make for a far more pleasant memory.
This is supposed to be the city of love... but chemically, I am sure that lust would be just as accurate.
Oh, ~closePlayer~, please let me know if my wings bother you. I'll try not to hit you with them, but I am afraid they are rather unwieldy in close quarters.

Well, I can't fault you for trying, but when has Battleborn ever defeated Overwatch, really?
Enjoy your forfeit, won't you?
It comes down to this last round. Good luck, ~opponent~!
Hm... I sense that one out of four doctors will not approve of this round of play.
Ah, I apologize if I seem somewhat discomforted by your presence, ~robot~. It is not your fault - just my own negative experiences with intelligent constructs.
Please, if I seem ill-at-ease around you, ~robot~, know that it is not your fault. I simply have some bad personal experiences with robotic entities.
Ah, I apologize if I seem somewhat discomforted by the presence of multiple robotic beings. It is not your fault - just my own negative experiences with intelligent constructs.
Please, if I seem ill-at-ease during this game, know that it is not any of your fault. I simply have some bad personal experiences with robotic entities.
Ah, it is so nice to get to see someone from my home country. Too rare is the occasion that I get the time for a proper visit these days.
Hm. I can't help but find myself discomforted by my company at this table. I prefer to associate with people who follow ethical guidelines.
Oh, I understand that some of you may be aware of me as Mercy - but please, call me Angela. I am not here as a hero, after all.
You know, ~companionOpponent~, you could have invited your friend to play with us rather than just sitting on the sidelines. We certainly have space enough.
Is there a reason you didn't invite your friend to join the game in proper, ~companionOpponent~? We have empty space at the table, after all.
Ah, so it's just me against you now, ~opponent~. Good luck - although I don't expect you'll need it. I've never been much good in single combat.
It comes down to just you and I, ~opponent~... I hope you will not think too poorly of my performance here. Without anyone else to use as a shield, I may not be much competition.
Ah, my current situation seems... less than ideal. It is unfortunate that my scientific and medical prowess to not carry over to skill at card games.
Seeing everyone else still so well-dressed while I am already down to my undergarments... Perhaps I should take a look at poker strategies when I next have time off.
The feeling of being exposed before an attentive audience... there is a level of allure in it that I am not sure I had understood until this moment.
It occurs to me that I have perhaps been taking this too seriously for what is intended to be a recreational activity. I will try to amend that.
I have been seeking new ways to relax and unwind as of late - do any of you here have any suggestions? Aside from strip poker, of course.
Has anyone else here engaged in casual sexual relationships? I've found them to be quite fulfilling, but I know my experiences are far from universal.
Ah, the prospect of group sex is one that I can't help but find quite thrilling. Is that just me? Surely some of you can relate?
Ah, there is quite a powerful allure in being told what to do to serve another's desires... but it is also very exciting to be the one in control. Do you all struggle with this too?
Ah, it is nice to have the chance to let my hair down - metaphorically, I mean. It may be a role that helps people, but being Mercy is quite strenuous.
I'm afraid I won't be providing medical consultations to~background.time~, but if any of you are in particular need, I'm sure I can give you my card for tomorrow.
Ah, it is nice to be out of my Valkyrie suit - it's hardly casual wear, after all.
Ah, yes... these things can be unpredictable. You are a good person to be caring for others in this way, Pyrrha.
As it happens, I can restore life to the clinically dead, albeit with some notable restrictions. That was one of my major breakthroughs with nanobiotics.
Ah. Well... yes, I can return the recently deceased, but it does have to be recent.
Magic? No, not at all! It's pure science, and works on Omnics just as well as humans, so I expect it could even serve to fix mishaps such as what happened with your head.

Magic? No, not at all; it's pure science, and works on Omnics and humans alike, so I expect it could even fix damage someone like you might take. Not that I've had an undead to test that theory on, of course.
Magic? No, not at all! It's pure science, and works on Omnics just as well as humans. Although, I'd be lying if I said it didn't feel almost like magic at times.
What!? That seems horribly dangerous! To go into a combat situation with no armor whatsoever... how do you stay safe?
I suppose so. Perhaps I am just overly sensitive about matters of manipulating such forces. Bad past experiences and such.
Ah, it is nothing! I worry easily, that is all. But if you do begin to hear those melodies, please, contact me as a matter of urgency.

state.text: Oh yes, the blonde jokes. I have heard them plenty of times before. Believe me, once you are a world-renowned doctor, they stop working quite so well.
Well yes, that is why we are all here after all, Ayano. We all chose to have fun taking our clothes off together. You are not suffering from memory loss, are you?
Oh, I am afraid that's a common misconception, Ayano - easy to happen when you practically stop aging in your twenties. This is all natural, and it will be whilever I still live.
Oh, I appreciate the worry Ayano, but my self-worth is quite healthy. Saving as many lives as I have tends to help with that.
Oh yes, perhaps it is. It's always worth using every natural advantage you have if you can. Of course, being a cutting-edge scientist and doctor helps too, it's not only the eyes.

condition.saying: I didn't think I'd meet yet another unusual doctor so soon

case.state: The way I heal people is... complex. Without going into the intricacies, I created a staff that can rapidly cure wounds. Who's this other "unusual doctor" you mentioned?
No, no, I was not suggesting I would kick you - although the longer you speak, the more appealing that thought becomes.
Well, I don't know about that... I like to think I'm just doing my part to protect people. I appreciate the sentiment though, Luxanna.
Oh, no, I'm just a human, the same as you. These wings are just part of my equipment - they help me to get to where I need to be to help people.
The way I heal people is... complex. Without going into the intricacies, I created a staff that can rapidly cure wounds, even in the middle of pitched combat.
Oh? I suppose you do have a certain brashness that makes me think you would need all of the healers you can get.

condition.saying: Huh. You're a bit older than any of my wives

case.state: Uh huh?

state.text:
Planet...?
Ah, well Switzerland is a wonderful place. Perhaps you should visit at some point?
That's a very kind offer, but I'm afraid I'm quite tied to my work with Overwatch. Not that your offer isn't very flattering... or that it doesn't sound like you could do with some help...

case.state: Ah, no - I can't say I have much practice with veterinary medicine. I work primarily with humans.
Oh, well that is good if it already poses no more threat! That gives me one less thing to worry about... unlike my poker skills, apparently.
So, there are... two Omnics, one called Aperture, and they are fighting over this facility... ah, we will have to talk more after the game. I have a layer to remove.
Oho, so you have heard of me? I suppose coming here in my combat gear, I was bound to be recognized at some point.
Oh, so Cat Noir himself is a fan? I cannot say I had expected that, but I am not displeased to hear it. I have heard tell of your own exploits - very impressive.
Well, my armor is not so impressively functional as yours, but it has its uses. Flight, protection... oh, and the halo is actually a visor I can use to monitor vitals.
My armor has its uses. It has rather less history than yours, as I understand it, but it protects me in a fight and allows me to fly to some extent, so it is far from useless.
Of course, I have nothing to hide. Ask away - and feel free to call me Angela.

Any question you like, so long as you stop with the terrible puns, ja?
Who am I kidding, that is not going to happen. What is your question?
No, not magic at all - just nanobiotics. I certainly understand how it might seem like magic to those outside of Overwatch, though.
No magic here, only science. Very advanced science, but science nonetheless. The kind you can only make with the resources Overwatch provides.
Why settle for only one? I am Doctor Angela Ziegler, MD, PhD. Do you have medical aspirations yourself? I would certainly recommend the University of Zurich.
Perhaps... but Mercy is who I am on the front lines, the fighter, the hero. "Mercy" is a shield to protect me from thinking about the harm I do for the greater good. This is a time for Angela.
...Amy, what is that tune? Are you... singing along to something?
A pop star? No, I am afraid not - I am a doctor. This outfit is what I wear into combat zones, to protect myself and inspire hope in others.
I cannot say anyone has ever made that particular suggestion before... not that it isn't flattering. No, I am a doctor, not a musical artist.
Ah, well, it is very nice of you to be interested, but I am quite busy...
Ah, that reminds me! I have been meaning to ask, Mettaton, just where do you believe this is being broadcast to?
There's really no reason for it to be considered bad at all. It isn't as though it has any adverse effects on health, after all. Who would even suggest that?
Oh, uh... no. I am sorry... unnamed member of Mettaton's staff... but my nanobiotics research can only restore the very recently deceased.
...yes, your legs seem... lovely, Mettaton.
Aha... no. My staff is elsewhere, and even if it weren't, why would that be a skill I would have?
...I am going to pretend that I didn't hear that question so we can all move on peacefully.

state.text: Oh, I study biology - in particular, the field of nanobiotics. My work with them is what allows me to heal others so effectively.

case.state: Hextech? No, there is no magic here, only science. I suppose that must be an uncommon sight in your world, though.
I do not believe that is something I am capable of, even with nanobiotics. That would be... genetic engineering, perhaps? Certainly outside my skillset as a doctor and scientist.
While I appreciate the compliment, Fate, please do not try to get hurt in order to flirt with a medic.
I should hope you wouldn't - if you got yourself injured just to flirt with me, you would be getting a slap to the back of the head before I started providing treatment.
I cannot say I am familiar with the fairy queen you reference, but I can only assume that such a comparison is intended to be flattering. Thank you.
Oh, that is very kind of you to say, Galatea. I have been told I can be overly formal in my English, but that is simply the way I learned it.
The very least I could do is attempt it, I suppose. I do not know if an x-ray could be altered to function on you, but a simple physical examination seems simple enough...

state.text: Ah... more difficult than you might imagine. Perhaps I could introduce you to Hammond, and you could give him tips on fur hygiene?

case.state: Ah, very perceptive, Senko. I suppose I must have something of an aura of tender care.
Are you sure you could do anything with my advice, Senko? My focus is almost entirely on wellness of the body, not the mind.
Oh! Thank you, Ibuki, that's very kind. I don't know if I'd really say what I did was deciding to be a hero, but... well, that does seem to be the situation I am now in.
Ah, just an unfortunate coincidence, I'm sure. But if you're looking for a checkup, I could certainly oblige.
I'm afraid that joke is one I've heard too often to retain novelty, Saki. It might take a little more originality to come up with a joke to amuse me - but you're welcome to try.
That sounds like precisely my role. You must be enjoying having the ~background.time~ off too - I may care about my teammates' wellbeing, but they have a way of being rather frustrating.

Well, the quarters were reasonable, but we had little in the way of masseuses - only a handful of physical therapists, and they were more focused on injury recovery than relaxation. Your presence would have been greatly appreciated, I expect.
That's very kind of you, Sucrose, but I'm afraid I'm not truly an angel, just a human. The design of this armor does make that quite a common misconception, don't worry.
Ah, I can understand the confusion, but I'm entirely human, I'm afraid. Don't worry, it's an easy mistake to make.
Oh, no, Sucrose, you don't have to call me "Master Mercy", really. Just "Angela" is fine.
No, no, Sucrose, please, just Angela is fine. There's no need for honorifics, I promise.
It's fine, Sucrose. Just call me whatever feels easiest for you. I don't mean to put you out by insisting on you using a name for me that feels too familiar.
Sucrose, really, you worry too much. Ultimately, I am fine with whatever you call me - just use whatever name is easiest.

Ah, that question is rather deceptively complex, Cynthia. As Mercy, my Caduceus staff protects from disease, but in my work helping civilians as Doctor Ziegler, my focus is often as much on disease as injury, as you say.

I'm afraid the answer is more complex than you might think, Cynthia. As a doctor, yes, I work on treating disease often more than injury, but when in combat myself, my staff cures diseases as well as it heals injuries.
Yes, Sucrose?
Ah, have you come up with a question, Sucrose?
My dream date... well, I am quite fond the idea of dinner at a restaurant followed by a walk in a park... but a surprise can be just as nice. How do they do dates in Bilgewater?

Oh, nothing too out of the ordinary. Dinner, some drinks, seeing where the night takes us...
But a surprise would be just as welcome. How do they do dates where you're from?
Now Fate, do you really want to know, or were you just looking for a way to flatter me? I'll take the compliment ether way, don't worry.
Very kind words from a man with such a dashing sense of style. I have to wonder though, do you really care about the answer, or were you just trying to flatter me?

Well, I don't know if that's the sole reason, but... yes, I suppose so. I've lost a number of people over my lifetime, and I'd prefer neither I nor anyone else have to feel that pain. It seems understandable that others might be shaped in that same way.
It's not the sole motivator, but yes, I suppose the people I've lost have shaped the way I treat others, and my desire to help others avoid that pain. Did it shape your friend similarly?
My team is... exceptionally varied... but our goal is to preserve world peace as best we can. Far from an easy task, as I'm sure you could guess.
My teammates are... quite a varied lot... but we all stand together to protect peace across the world as best we can. Far from an easy role, I can assure you.
Well, most of my advanced work with nanobiotics is classified, I'm afraid, but I'm sure there's plenty of answers I can still provide. Do you have a question in mind, Wikipe-tan?
My nanobiotics work is classified, I'm afraid, but I'm happy to provide general medical advice. Do you have a specific question you need answered?
I earned my medical degree at a university - a learning institution, not unlike the one you attend, but specialized in medicine. Do you have medical schools where you are from?
My medical knowledge stems foremost from my university education, at a specialized school for medicine. Do your wise women have a similar institution?
Oh, no, not at all! This is my Valkyrie suit, which only I possess. It's designed to aid me on the battlefield, both to protect me from enemy fire and to give me great mobility.
No, no, this is a piece of special equipment only I may use. It's designed to provide me with great mobility while protecting me on the front lines of conflict.
Oh. Ah. Hm. I... do not mean to embarrass you, Jessie, but my accent is actually Swiss. We do border on France, so I suppose it's an easy mistake to make. No need to worry.
Ah, I... Ahem. I appreciate the compliment, Jessie, but I am Swiss, not French. We share a border, of course, so it's an easy mistake! You needn't feel at all embarrassed by it.

Well, we originally formed to combat the Omnic threat, but with the Omniums shut down and Omnics having gained free will, we now combat terrorist groups like Talon. Do you face threats like that yourself?

Well, these days we mostly fight Talon terrorists, who believe that the path to a stronger humanity is through conflict, but originally we only existed to counter the threat of the Omnium hive minds. Is that anything like the threats you face?

Well, yes and no. It's certainly drawn attention from my field use, and the basic nanobiotic theory is publicly available through my published research papers, but my staff uses classified military technology, so it isn't in wide use quite yet, unfortunately.

Well, my Caduceus staff has certainly drawn attention, but the technology it uses is considered classified by Overwatch. The base theory is publicly available in my research papers, but the applied form isn't yet widely available, unfortunately.
Oh, yes, well, this isn't my usual lab attire. When I'm doing my research, I prefer an outfit rather more like what you arrived in, Heris.
Oh, this outfit is... very much not suited for laboratory situations. I prefer something more casual, akin to what you yourself arrived in, when I'm doing my research.
Me? In front of all those people? Nein, I could not. Even if I were to have the looks for such a job, I'm far more comfortable in my lab.
Foretellers of the fallen...? Well, in certain circles, I suppose so, yes. I wouldn't consider myself to be such an omen them, though.
Personally, I wouldn't consider myself a "foreteller of the fallen". A savior of those in need, perhaps, but not some omen of death.
W-Well, I'm inclined to say that depends on just how dead they are. Plenty of surgeons bring people back from being clinically dead. I just have a slightly longer window in which to do so.
Well... yes and no. I can't imagine that those who are medically dead for a matter of seconds have any issue with being revived, whether by myself or a skilled surgeon.
Perhaps. I'm inclined to believe that the people I save would rather be approached by an angel than a purple cyborg assembled in a discount pharmacy.

Nobody seems to complain on the battlefield when I'm saving them. Do you think the same could be said if they were instead approached by a pint-sized stilt-walker who can't shake anyone's hand without stabbing them?
Ah, it's always nice to meet a fan of my work - especially one with such a rich selection of exploits herself.
Oh? Paris's very own Ladybug is a fan of my work? That's a pleasant surprise. I'm impressed with what I've heard of you, too.
Oh, it's big, and varied, and wonderful... No two places are alike, really. Is there anywhere you've especially wanted to visit?
The world is... Ah, you can't describe it all at once! It's huge, and beautiful, and no two places are quite alike. Is there anywhere specific you wish to visit yourself?

I understand that you're flirting with me, but as a doctor of medicine and medical technology, I would genuinely enjoy an exploration of your anatomy, Dorothy. I'm familiar enough with Omnic construction, but yours seems fascinatingly different.

I'm a doctor both of medicine and medical research, so while I understand that you're flirting with me, an examination of your Lilim construction sounds genuinely fascinating to me, Dorothy. It seems to differ vastly from that of the Omnics I've encountered.

That is... a difficult question. Omnics do not have genitals, and, as far as I know, do not experience sexual attraction, but I expect at least a few would work in the sex trade, catering to those humans attracted to Omnics.

Hm... I have yet to encounter reports of an Omnic feeling sexual attraction to anyone, human or Omnic, but I'm certain there are humans who fetishize Omnics. That being the case, there must surely be some who perform sex work.
It's certainly better than when the Omniums were active, but I wouldn't say the current peace is without flaws. It can be difficult to reconcile what the Omnics once were with what they are now.

Certainly, it's better than the Omnic Crisis, but our peace is not without complexity. Reconciling the image of the hive mind of killing machines we knew with the individual and free Omnics of today is... sometimes difficult.
I suppose it is a little cliche, ja. I don't mind it, though. It's hardly a problem to know who can heal you, after all.
It is a little cliche, perhaps, but I don't know that's a bad thing. Being able to tell at a glance who can help you when you're injured is hardly a problem.
Unique is certainly an apt descriptor. I've had to quite significantly expand the scope of my expertise in order to keep abreast of all of their needs.
And what a kaleidoscope of characters they are. Trying to provide medical care for so many diverse and uniquely difficult patients is no simple task.

No, I'm afraid that's true. While the things we can do sometimes seem magical, there's science backing everything we do.
{small}Well, everything I do, at least.

No cover story there, I'm afraid. Plenty of it probably looks like magic from the outside, but our abilities are all based in science.
{small}Well, my abilities are, anyway.

state.text: A necessary evil I'm afraid, Ayano. A good doctor has to be able to command the room when needed.
You should stop listening to rumors so much, Ayano - make your own decisions about people, don't give in to peer pressure.

case.state: Ah, it appears I am first. Well, it had to be someone, so it is much the same to me.
It seems I am first to lose, then? Well, I can only hope this doesn't portend future misfortune.

state.text: I was probably due a loss by now. Ah well, it was good while it lasted.
And here I was thinking I'd found the secret to strip poker. Ah well, it is a fair loss.

case.state: Well, I suppose that means I'll be the first to be truly showing off my body. I hope you'll all enjoy it.
So I am the first to lose all clothing? Very well, I am used to leading by example.
Let us start with my gloves.
I should start with something small - my gloves.
I believe I will start with my gloves - I shouldn't need them here.
Ah, my first loss. It seems only appropriate to start small, no?
Well, time for you to inspect me.
Das ist mir Wurst.
I don't think I need my boots anymore.
A second loss... my boots seem the obvious choice.
My boots should be a reasonable loss.
Perhaps I should've picked something more casual for this...
I suppose it is time to lose my armor.
Now "Mercy" becomes "Angela".
It's only logical for my stockings to be next.
Don't be getting too excited yet - I still have my panties under these.
Time for my full-body examination, it seems.
I hope you all won't find my nudity too distracting.
I know none of you are doctors, but I hope you won't mind giving me a full-body examination anyway.
Oh, what to take off next...
Just how should I expose myself to you all... decisions, decisions...
Well, it seems about time. I was almost feeling left out.
Oh, good, I was wondering when I would lose. I wouldn't want you all to think I was cheating.
Well, I suppose it was folly to think I wouldn't have to expose myself.
A fair loss deserving of a fair prize.
Well, if ever there was a reminder to not be overconfident, that seems an effective one. My strategy needs refinement.
Well, considering how the rest of you are faring, I don't mind a loss here.
Unfortunate, but far from unrecoverable. I can handle a couple of losses, especially considering the state of the rest of you.
Ah, of course. I had hoped it would not come to this, but such is the way of these things, I suppose.
Ah, my final layer is lost. Very well. This game is supposed to be thrilling, so a close finish seems only fair.
Such is the nature of a game of chance.
Ah, that's my loss, yes? I understand - it's quite literally the luck of the draw, after all.
Ah, I had hoped I would have more of a lead to work with... but I can still win from here.
I've faced more adverse odds than this and still come out unscathed. Do your worst.
Ah, that's how the game goes. Don't go counting me out just yet, I can still pull through.
Well, that's rather unfortunate. Make sure to at least enjoy the view, won't you?
Ah, an unfortunate way to begin. I can only hope things improve from here.
Oh! Another loss already? I wasn't expecting you all to be quite so competitive...
Hm. Rather unfortunate, but I can handle having the fewest layers.
Not my preferred position, but I still have leeway to fight back.
Ah, darn. I should have known this would happen. Well, I still have a chance, so don't go counting me out yet!
Well, I still have at least one round left in me. I might have to forfeit, but if I do, I'll have at least tried to take you down first.
It seems you have me cornered... but beware! A doctor is at her most dangerous when she is cornered.
Oh, I'll be making sure I'm paid back for this, and with interest no less.

Well, it seems I'm quite on the back foot here. What a pity. I suppose that just means that I'll have to reveal...
{b}my secret weapon!{!reset}

Ah, I had hoped it would not come to this, but in a situation like this, I have no choice but to reveal...
{b}my secret weapon!{!reset}

It would seem that my back is rather against the wall, metaphorically. Then I have no choice. It is time to reveal...
{b}my secret weapon!{!reset}
...did I sound convincingly threatening? Genji and Hana have suggested I attempt "psychological warfare", but I'm afraid I'm not much good.
...did I almost fool you? Ah, maybe next time. I am not much of an actor. No, if I had a secret weapon, I'd have used it long before now.
Well, that's quite the offer, Adrien. Why don't you lose some more and we can see just how messy we would get, hm?
Hmm... well, that is quite a tempting offer you make, Adrien. Perhaps we should...
Well, it is quite advanced. The main issue I have been trying to solve is the limited time frame for effectiveness - even my most impressive success was only one minute after death.
Yes, I can understand. Such a prospect feels enticing, but... no, as far as I know, you are long past the point where my nanobiotics abilities could help.
...Well, it was a valiant attempt, albeit one rather short-lived. Do feel free to let me know if another one occurs to you later on.
Ah, you are correct. My armor was designed to inspire hope, especially when aiding civilians. I suppose that means that in a way, it is art itself, no?
Precisely. The Valkyrie armor was created with the intent to both make aiding civilians easy, and to ease their worries when doing so. I suppose, in some ways, it is art in itself.
Well, I suppose that's true. Frankly, I joined Overwatch originally so they'd provide funding for my nanobiotics research, and that was how I expected to help people. How times change, hm?
In a sense, I suppose so. I originally thought my calling was solely in my nanobiotics research, but now... well, you can see where it took me.
Oh, it's extremely effective - it heals even grievous wounds in seconds, and from a distance of several meters. The main issue at the moment is the power consumption.
My work with nanobiotics has proven them to be extremely effective, but the issues with power consumption have proven rather difficult to resolve.
Well, it's nice to hear that there are others who have felt pain but not allowed it to harden their hearts. In my profession, that's rather more rare than I would like.
Well, it's good to hear that she's found new people to care for, even if you find her a little smothering. I know too many who have felt pain and allowed it to turn them to dispassion.
In case it... what? No, you seem to misunderstand. I don't use my Caduceus staff to strike things, I generate a stream of healing nanobiotics. No chance of injury at all.
My staff is highly advanced equipment, Saki. It doesn't function by striking anyone, it simply generates a flow of healing nanobiotics. You and any other idols in the area are perfectly safe.
If you insist, Saki, then I will be sure not to use it to attempt to heal you. I can't possibly imagine any scenario where what you describe come to pass, though.
Those both seem like exceptionally unlikely possibilities to the point of absurdity but I'll respect your wishes regardless. Such is the role of the physician, after all.
Ah, of course. I should have expected nothing less. Well, I'm afraid that's a tradition I'd rather not take part in, but I'd gladly settle for drinks and seeing where the night takes us.
Well, I'm afraid that's one Bilgewater custom I'd rather not partake in, but it seems to fit the picture you've painted of the place. Why don't we start with drinks and plan for spontaneity?
Well, if you're truly interested, the idea was to provide a symbol of hope on the battlefield, for those who are injured and in need of rescue. The intent was to become a "guardian angel".
In that case, the answer is one you might have already surmised; to project hope. There are few sights as comforting as a guardian angel coming to your rescue, after all.
That sounds like quite the task. How odd it is, that we come from such different worlds, yet seem so similar. Not that I mind, of course. You seem perfectly lovely, Fina.
It's good to know that bringing peace is a universal goal. In fact, I find it a little odd how entirely alike you and I are, Fina. Not that I'm unhappy about it - quite the opposite.
Hm. I... well... ah, no. Not any more, at least. But if I find an ethical experimental geneticist, I can let you know.
Oh yes, I am rather too familiar with that brand of foolhardiness myself. They at least have the sense to keep you safe and away from enemies in combat, I hope?
Ah, an experience I know all too well. I hope that they at least have the sense to keep you safely off of the front lines?

In a sense, yes. Omniums were factories designed to constantly self-improve their manufactured robots. A military force mass-produced to fix weak points as they were discovered proved very difficult to combat. It took worldwide alliances to simply slow them down, and the formation of Overwatch to end their threat.

That seems a fair description. Omniums were originally created to be factories that would self-iterate to eliminate design flaws in their mass-produced robots. When used for military purposes, any new weak points discovered were quickly remedied. It took international cooperation and the formation of Overwatch to bring their threat to an end.

If Talon were simply seeking wealth, they'd be much less of a threat. No, they believe that the only way to advance as a civilization is through conflict, so they wish to spread fear and incite war across the globe.

If Talon's motives lay simply in greed, they would be much less dangerous. Unfortunately, their goals lie in the supposed advancement of humanity through conflict. To that end, they seek to incite violence and spark wars across the world.
Oh, this? It is largely to protect me in combat, but it has a few useful features, like a heads-up display for me to monitor the health of my allies, and limited flight capabilities.
The flavor of...? I'm sorry, I'm not sure I understand the context of your flirting. Have you produced a video with a Swiss woman in the past? What background am I missing here?
The... flavor? I... You're trying to flirt with me, I understand that, but what's your point about the taste of Swiss women? I'm sorry, I'm truly at a loss.

You and I are of one mind on that front, Cynthia. I've been quite careful in the deals I've made to achieve my funding, but there are certainly unscrupulous individuals who are too drawn to nanobiotics' potential as a weapon to consider the ethics of such a thing.

I'd much rather my work be freely available to the public, but the draw of such a powerful tool as a weapon has proven too great a draw for me to release them publicly yet. Not everyone is as concerned with the ethical ramifications of their actions as I am.

Unethical? I can't see how it would be...
{small}Certain religious beliefs aside, I suppose...

I'm not sure I understand. Why would saving a life be unethical?
{small}Unless you belong to a religion that feels strongly about what happens to a body after death, I suppose...
Of course. Overwatch would be remiss if we did not keep an eye on the up-and-coming heroes of the world. It's a delight to see you in person, though, ~ladybug~.
Overwatch likes to keep an eye on exceptional people. It shouldn't be a surprise you number among them. It's a pleasure to properly make your acquaintance, ~ladybug~.
Precisely. I like to think it inspires hope, too - when I'm helping civilians, the last thing I want to do is frighten them. Being a guardian angel helps with that.
Exactly. I like to think it helps when I'm rescuing civilians, too. After all, a guardian angel is a much more welcome sight than a dark-clad grim reaper.
I can't say I've spent much time in Argentina or Chile, but if you're interested in South America, I have spent some time in Brazil, and it was wonderful.
Well, I'm quite fond of my home nation of Switzerland. If you're interested in historical tourism, we have some incredible castles, and if not, the skiing and chocolate are both top-notch.

As it's the most Omnic-friendly city on Earth, many Omnics make a point of visiting Numbani at least once. I know you aren't an Omnic yourself, but I expect there's plenty of specialties there for any synthetic humanoid.

The beaches of Australia are lovely, but I'm afraid for you specifically, I can't recommend it as a destination. Anti-Omnic sentiment is strong there, and I doubt the fact that you're a different form of synthetic humanoid would alleviate that.
That sounds like a wonderful idea, then. I might even be able to pass the cost to Overwatch as a research expense...
I might have to take you up on that offer. In fact, seeing as it is a research expense, I don't see why I couldn't have Overwatch pay for it...
Well, the Omniums were essentially sentient factories that produced Omnics, and they were ruthless in their design decisions. I expect they considered any form of pleasure or self-expression a waste.
Well, the Omnics were designed by the Omniums for ruthless efficiency. They were never intended to have free will, so any sort of pleasure or self-expression must have been considered a waste.
Considering you wear parts of them as armor, I can believe that. It's taken quite an adjustment period, but I hope our relative peace can last.
Considering you made armor from those machines, I can understand that being difficult. My world is lucky to have a relative peace, and I only hope it can last.
Precisely. Just because I operate solely in the former doesn't mean that the latter aren't just as effective. Your miraculous does things I can only dream of.
Exactly, but I'd be a poor scientist if I rejected reality because it didn't conform to my theories. Your miraculous does things my technology cannot, and that makes it all the more valuable.

condition.saying: You...can bring people back from the dead...right? Is there...a time limit on that?

state.text: I am afraid so, yes... I may seem to work miracles, but even my powers can only do so much.

case.state: Used to it? Perhaps. I can't say I can ever quite ignore it. I simply focus on being professional and push through.
I am, yes. What of it?
No, not at all. All we have is good, old-fashioned science. Nothing like the wonders I have seen from others like yourself.
No, nothing like that - just science. Admittedly, more advanced science than most others here, but science nonetheless. I hear that is not the case for you, however.
Pfft- ah, that was terrible!
Pfft- ah, you are no hero! You are a terror on the innocents around you!
Ah, that seems like a very powerful ability to be able to share.
Beeindruckend! One of the few things better than a healer is to prevent the damage from having happened in the first place.
Oh? And why would that be, Adrien?
Now what makes you say that, hm?
Games? No, Overwatch is my organization. We are peacekeepers and protectors - I myself am a doctor.
Ah, a very admirable goal to have! If you don't mind my asking, is there a reason for your interest in that area?

Ah yes, it is wise to consider your personal skills before a call-sign.
Better still to not need to enter combat at all.

Then, if you are hearing songs... is it perhaps like Dr. De Kuiper...?
(Then her brain troubles might be... ah, that is worrying...)
Well, that is lovely for you to say. I am afraid my position doesn't hold quite the same prestige as a celebrity icon, though.

Oh! Yes, of course, that makes more sense.
No, my work doesn't give me opportunities to date, but I do enjoy a sexual partner or two, when it is convenient.
That sounds lovely! I would gladly show you my thesis - ah, that may be a bit advanced, even for you. But I can certainly explain the basics, at the very least!
Oh, no, no - my expertise is entirely medical, not mechanical. This armor, wings included, was kindly provided by the engineers of Overwatch.
I could never build such masterful work as this myself, I am afraid. No, these were provided by Overwatch as part of my agreement to enter the battlefield.
I would expect it to be a good incentive to stay by my side, but it seems perhaps that you have more common sense than some of my teammates, Nami.
Any fresh wound I have thus far encountered, yes - and yet I still often face difficulty in keeping my allies by my side.
I can see what you mean about unusual doctors! I cannot imagine the inside of a whale to be a very good surgical environment, though...
You have certainly met quite a few unusual doctors! I hope your ship doctor being a reindeer does not cause too many issues...
That is quite the array of unusual doctors! That Doctor Traffy sounds to be quite unique if he can perform a heart transplant safely.
Ah, my Valkyrie suit was created by some of the finest engineers on the planet, with vast resources. They are not generally open for commissions outside of Overwatch, I am afraid.
Aura? I cannot say I have heard of that as a protection technique... but I suppose if it is effective, I cannot critique it...
Ah, I am sorry, I did not mean to make you worry unduly. If you are confident it is safe, then I believe you. You seem to be a responsible young woman.
Ah... I am afraid I do not know myself. It is only from the semi-lucid murmurings of a man who can manipulate gravity that I know about them at all.
Perhaps. Even a doctor like me needs to take some time out for self-care now and again, after all.
Ah, that makes perfect sense. In that case, I would quite enjoy a proper discussion of techniques - perhaps once the game is over?
Very direct, aren't you? I'm afraid that isn't information I give out freely - if you want to find out, perhaps you should take me out to dinner first?
Oh, you are just incorrigible, Fate. I don't know about Bilgewater, but where I come from, most men suggest getting dinner before offering to get shot for a woman.
Oh! Well, perhaps not that, then. How do you feel about Australians? I can think of at least one in need of hair care tips.
Oh, of course you do. Every man seems to think he's hilarious and original when he hears that I'm a doctor, thinking he should ask for an inspection of his...
Well, if you're seriously considering it, then the planet you're looking for would be Earth - possibly also known as Terra. Switzerland is simply the nation I come from.
I don't know that my Earth's technology could be better than what you have - we haven't achieved faster-than-light travel, after all. My nanobiotics must be quite simple compared to what you use.
Well, if you ever care to visit, you'd be welcomed with open arms. Healers get few legends, but if anyone deserves it, I expect it would be you.
Oh, Senko, you needn't be jealous. All bodies are beautiful, you should know that.
I... suppose you could call it alchemy, yes, but technology would be more appropriate. It may be worth discussing this later, rather than boring our fellow players, however.
Ah, I engage with the technological rather than the supernatural, I'm afraid. Perhaps this conversation is better saved for later? I expect we may have to go into significant depth.
I appreciate the thought, but we're equals here, I promise - and as your equal, I would be happy to answer any questions you'd care to ask.
That's very kind, Sucrose, but wholly unnecessary. This isn't a class and I'm not a teacher, but I'll still gladly answer any questions you pose.
Yes, that sounds like a fine idea, Sucrose. I think we could probably both do with "loosening up" a little, don't you think? I think being out of this armor should certainly help me with that.
Often? No, not especially, but not for lack of wanting. I simply don't get many opportunities for time off.
Not often, no, but that's only because of my demanding schedule. If I had more time, I'd likely engage in games like this more often.
Well, thank you. Your own diction and elocution strike me as excellent, but I'm afraid I don't have a frame of reference for typical speech from animate statues to judge properly.
Thank you, Galatea. You are the first statue I have conversed with, so I don't have much to compare you against, but it seems to me that your own speech is excellent too.
Not at all. In fact, I would be glad to help in understanding your physiology. Perhaps we could reconvene at my lab once this game is finished?
Not in the slightest. I am more than happy to aid you in your self-understanding however I can. Perhaps we could reconvene at my lab, once we are finished here?
I prefer to think of myself as a healer first, combatant second, but yes, my boots are quite protective, Fischl. My entire Valkyrie suit is designed for combat.
I'd rather be a healer who sometimes fights than a combat healer... But yes, my Valkyrie suit is quite effective protection in combat, boots included.
A pity that I must now remove it, no? It was designed to be beautiful. Seeing an angel fly in to heal you... Well, doesn't that seem like it could inspire hope on any battlefield?
A pity I have to remove it to continue, then. It was designed to inspire hope in my allies on the battlefield. I can't say if it truly works, but I'm certainly not complaining about the aesthetics.
Nicely saved. Very smooth.
I won't mind losing these. It's plenty warm in here anyway.
I don't expect I'll need to be worrying about keeping my hands clean to~background.time~.
One undresses in the reverse order to how they dress, no? Then the gloves come off first.
Although you should always wear shoes when going on longer walks...
