I hope the ~background.surface~ doesn't have any concealed dangers - these boots are excellent protection, but my feet may as well be bare in my stockings.
The protection these boots provide is certainly worthwhile in combat, but in a game like this, the freedom of having them off is quite nice.
You know, I still don't know who signed off on these boots being designed with heels. I can appreciate an aesthetic, but for combat use? Really?
It's quite difficult to replace inner organs, so it's always wise to wear armor into battle and reduce your medical bill.
Ah, getting my Valkyrie suit off is far from easy. A fair price to pay for the protection it provides, I suppose.
I've just got to-- oh, that clip is stuck again. Okay, if I just wiggle it a little like-- ah, there it goes! I'd feel so embarrassed getting stuck in my own armor in front of you all.
These stockings are very flexible for battle, and they keep blood circulation in the legs high as well. I provided consultation with the designers while they created them, after all.
Farewell, stockings. You have served me well, but it seems I need to rely on my undergarments alone now.
Well, that takes the last of my outerwear. I'd hoped I'd be able to keep a few more layers than this...
I try to avoid wearing bras - they can be bad for your breasts, especially aesthetically.
Good thing I wore a bra to~background.time~. They're not always comfortable, but I appreciate the extra layer right now.
Well, here goes nothing. I hope you'll all at least appreciate them - I've been reliably informed that my breasts are quite nice.
It's wise to ensure your undergarments are made of good, breathable materials. Vaginal health is important.
Well, I suppose this has to be my last layer. I don't suppose anyone here is willing to help me with a dramatic comeback, are they?
Not my finest hour... Well, I just hope none of you are here to judge my poker performance.
Oh, yes, of course! Even if your relationship is an open one, poor communication can lead to hurt feelings. If you want me to stop, ~ladybug~, I'll do so without complaint.

If it makes you feel any better, Marinette, I would never do anything with Adrien that you do not sanction. That said... I would be more than happy to include you, if that would help you feel better about it~...

If it makes you feel any better, Marinette, I would never do anything with Adrien that you do not sanction. That said... I would be more than happy to include you, if that would help you feel better about it~...
Less so than you might think. Let us just say that Overwatch has a communal locker room.
Oh, I'm sure it is. And it may well get even more interesting very soon...
Ah yes, Winston is quite fond of quoting that line whenever we come up against anything unusual. I cannot say it has held true in all of my experiences here, however...

Those would have to be metaphorical sleeves at the moment, no?
But yes, I agree, even if most of the "advanced technology" I have seen here is beyond me.
That is good to hear - I do sometimes worry about those teams who lack in healing ability. But I suppose your magical abilities help with that, yes?
It is not a problem at all. I am sorry if I got your hopes up for the revival of a family member - I do try not to give false impressions of my limitations.
You are well within your rights to grieve for the life you could have led. I can only imagine the emotional duress you must be under, and I am sorry I cannot be of more help.
Ah, you really do seem to understand me very well, Senko. I'm looking forward to seeing how this game plays out with you.
Perfect. His name is Jameson Fawkes. Oh, and if you do meet, please make sure it is somewhere with minimal possibility for collateral damage - more for my sake than your own.
Well, thank you, Ibuki. The universe has a way of making fools of us all, but one way or another, I found saving lives to be my calling. I'm sure you're on the path to yours, knowingly or otherwise.
That's very kind, Ibuki. I was lucky to find my calling early, even if my destination turned out to be something of a surprise. I'm sure you'll reach yours soon, one way or another.

Well, that's quite a kind offer, but I'm not sure how much aid your Blue Rogues can provide, given the scale of our enemies. Still, it's an offer I'll keep in mind. I doubt we'd be opposed to having extra hands to help.
Many hands make light work, as the saying goes. I don't feel I can really ask you to risk your lives for our fight, but I'll keep it in mind. Maybe a crew of sky pirates is just what we need.
I'm afraid I will not be of much help, then. Genetic engineering is still very experimental in my world. There must be somebody in this strange place who can help, though, surely.
Generally, yes. It isn't uncommon for foes to seek me out as a priority target, but my allies do try to keep me safe as best they can - and when they can't, I do have a weapon of my own.
For the most part. I have to draw my pistol more than I'd like, but most of the time I can safely stick to tending to wounds and empowering attacks.
You have a kind heart, Ibuki. Dealing with pain is hard, and can be deeply personal, but so long as you are there to provide her support when she needs it, you'll be doing all you can.
The pain of loss leaves deep scars, and only time can dull the sharp sting. So long as you're by her side to support her, you'll be doing everything she needs you to do.
Well, you'll be glad to hear I'm quite the opposite. My role is to protect life, not to... end undeath, if you wish to stick to your metaphor. A doctor does not judge, she only heals.

Ah, then I have good news. Regardless of any moralistic associations you may have regarding angels, my goal is always to preserve life. If it keeps them living, I'd gladly drag my allies back through heaven's gates.
Precisely. In the combats I face, having a single person who can serve as a mobile field hospital is extremely useful. No expense was spared in the creation of my equipment.

Ah, exactly. When I enter combat, my allies rely on me to provide an entire hospital's worth of medical care, so when I worked with Overwatch to create the Valkyrie suit, we ensured the technology was cutting-edge.
I don't really believe that to be true, no matter who you may be, but I won't treat you if it's against your wishes, Saki. You have my word.
I can't really imagine anyone being "beyond the jurisdiction" of a doctor without being quite thoroughly dead, but I can still promise to not treat you if you wish, Saki.

Most doctors, perhaps, but I've multiple times revived the clinically dead. Nanobiotics are quite effective for that. I can't say with certainty how they'd affect the supernaturally animated, but that's mostly from a lack of data.
Perhaps most doctors, but my work has revived the clinically dead many times. How nanobiotics would affect your supernatural form, I'm not sure, but that's mostly a simple lack of data.
Exactly my thoughts on the matter. If a situation is dire enough to require the use of my staff, we can spare the energy required.
Precisely, yes. If a combat situation is so dangerous as to require my presence, the energy costs involved will certainly be offset by the efficacy of my abilities.

Exceptionally dangerous, yes. Many of the Omnics that were once controlled by Omniums are now integrated into our society, but with the Siberian Omnium recently returning to operation, I fear the war may soon reignite.

Potentially catastrophic, yes. With the Omnics now free to live their own lives, many have successfully integrated into human society, but tension remains, and with the Siberian Omnium's reawakening, I fear things may worsen before they improve.
I agree entirely, Fina, but no argument yet has dissuaded them. They simply believe that any who die because of their actions deserved it, for not being strong enough.
You and I are united on that, Fina, but Talon's loyalists simply believe that anyone who dies from their actions merely proved too weak to survive. They are truly monstrous.

Oh! I see now! I simply haven't encountered that brand of drink.
More to the point, thank you for the compliment. I'm afraid I'm not prepared to be quite as forward as you, but I have no problems with admitting you are quite attractive.

Oh! I wasn't aware of that brand of drink! Ah, the perils of cross-cultural flirting...
More importantly, thank you for your compliment, Jessie. I'm not prepared to be quite so forward, but you're quite attractive yourself.
Oh, believe me, Aaravi, I am plenty competent. My degrees aren't just for show. Perhaps I can give you a demonstration of nanobiotics in action later.
There's no question of competence, Aaravi - my degrees were earned, and my research has borne significant fruit. Perhaps I can show you my nanobiotics in action later.

I'd be remiss if I didn't take full advantage of the opportunity, so an internal examination is a fine idea. And, if I finish my work and have some more time with you already paid for... perhaps I could see just how good you are at what you do.

Of course, an internal examination is all part of a thorough investigation. That said, seeing as I expect you bill by the hour, if we end up with more time than I need for my research, I just might have to experience the quality of your work firsthand.
Oh, I'm certain I will. That said, I can assure you that nothing going on here to~background.time~ is going to be appearing in any official reports, so don't feel like you need to hold back, ja?

Oh, you say that like you could ever leave a bad impression. So you know, though, I won't be entering anything that happens here to~background.time~ into any sort of official report. What we do in our off-time is no business of Overwatch's.
Ah, I do try not to rub it in... it is just one of the more pleasant side effects of my work.
You seem to read into things a lot, Ayano. Perhaps you should be turning that attention more towards trying to win, hm?
If you aren't looking forward to the game approaching its climax, perhaps you are playing the wrong game, Ayano.
I'm afraid not. Not only would it take hours to properly re-size it for you, the legal issues with the contracts I would be breaking would be... difficult, to say the least.
Perhaps, but doing so would make the entire suit more difficult to maneuver in. I think the tassets attached to the chest piece and boots do fine work protecting me as they are.
You heard no such thing! I swear, if you weren't so cute, I just might break my Hippocratic Oath...
If I did laugh, then that is a fact I will deny to my deathbed, you understand?
Ah, yes! Lena is displaced in time. Even if she can sometimes prevent her own harm, she is still plenty grateful for my help in accelerating her healing when she cannot.
Ah, yes! Lena - Tracer, as you may know her better - is displaced in time. My healing works on a very different principle - complex nanobiotics. It is not talk for here, frankly.
Well, you certainly seem to be trying to compete with me for that title, no? Designer, model, hero...
It's not all talent, you know. Getting to be a world-renowned doctor takes some hard work - and so does maintaining a body like this.
Oh? You certainly seem to be paying plenty of attention to those features. Are you imagining me wearing something different?
Ah, of course. Here I was thinking you might be worried about sharing a locker room...
Oh yes, very admirable indeed. You're just considering the good of all, no?
Why would they... ah! I did not understand at first! You are attempting to trash-talk our competitors, no? Yes, after my victory I am sure they will be in need of consolation.
Ah, I am sorry to hear that. Turning your own struggles into motivation to help others is a very admirable. This world can always do with more understanding and passion.
Just... be careful. Do not glorify combat for what you have seen of it through me.
Yes... perhaps you should. He is more of an astrophysicist than a neuroscientist, but... well, I can only hope you find common ground.
Idol music? I have not listened to enough to really have an opinion, I am afraid. Perhaps I should look for some of Franchouchou's work once the game is over.
Ah, I suddenly feel I may have over-shared... but it is true, and sexual health is important.
Oh, yes of course! Despite the best efforts of terrorists like Talon, they haven't managed to create their own - at least, not to this same level of quality.
Allowing this sort of thing to fall into the hands of terrorists would be unconscionable, of course! I and everyone else work to keep it all confidential, I assure you.
He sounds like an excellent reindeer to have around, then. My experiences of sapient animals have been quite positive, so it is good to hear that holds true elsewhere.
Oh! That is quite the achievement for a doctor. I can see what you mean about him being unusual, but clearly very skilled.
I cannot imagine ever living inside a patient to treat them, but I suppose if it worked, I have no room to criticize.

Ah, if I were to go on about all of my issues with them, we would be here all ~background.time~. Still, they do good work, even if it means suffering significant injuries. Really, I complain because I care.
Oh, I grumble more than I should, really. If they weren't so good at what they do, I do not know if I would be around to complain at all.

...Oh. I... well, that does sound like a serious problem.
Ah, yes, that seems to be infected. You should seek medical attention as soon as feasible.

Ah, you flirt! You must use that line on all the ladies.
Not that I mind - it's nice to be a lady rather than a doctor, now and then.
Now wasn't that much more pleasant than being shot? I swear, some people are willing to do the most dangerous things for attention...
It's a date. I may be known for my work as a doctor, you know, but I do still prefer a nice dinner to performing surgery.
Well, that sounds just lovely. I always welcome the opportunity to expand my skills, especially if it comes with the added benefit of a new ally in medical practice.
You're far from being without your own appeal, Senko. You may be petite, but you are adorable, and so unbelievably caring. I'm sure there are plenty who would prefer you to me.
Well, I quite like the look myself, and I am sure it would look cute on you as well, but your concern is a valid one. As a scientist, I think the best course of action is experimentation.
No, no, there is nothing wrong with seeking to help others - in fact, I find it an admirable trait. I merely mean that others here may resent us holding up their strip poker game for it.
I entirely understand, truly - knowledge of advanced techniques can do wonders to aid others. I simply feel it may be better to have that conversation not during a strip poker game.
My knowledge is at your disposal, so feel free to ask me anything you like. There are no bad questions, after all.
Oh, you worry so much, Sucrose. I'm sure there must be plenty of alchemists back in Teyvat who would gladly collaborate with you, given the chance. I know I certainly would.

I assume "self-exploration" is in the sense of personal sexuality? I've found pornography to be quite useful for such endeavors. Engaging with a piece that heavily features a potential point of interest during masturbation can be quite illuminating.

Ah, I've found that such "self-exploration" is best achieved via pornography focused on the point of interest at hand, and if that proves fruitful, attempting it with a consenting partner. Trial and error is an excellent teacher.
Oh relax, I am just toying with you, Aster. Perhaps you should try to be a little more tactful in future, yes?
Oh, no, there is no inherent health benefit to shaving, just personal preference. Not shaving is certainly more natural, but neither is unhealthy.
No, no, not at all. This is just more common in Western Europe than Asia - no health benefits one way or the other.
You are welcome to stare, if you like. I am the only one exposed, after all.
Walking barefoot sometimes can be a very healthy exercise.
I can just as well do without them, though - they are simply good to have in battle to avoid cramping.
It is always important to keep your hands clean.
Well, those gloves would have had to come off before the Valkyrie suit one way or another.
I hope you don't mind me starting with something so small. I understand some people here take issue with that.
Well, it is not as though I had planned to go into battle today anyway.
Do not think that I am helpless without my armor. I may be a healer, but I am well-versed in self-defense.
I do appreciate my Valkyrie suit, but removing it after a day's work is really a freeing experience like no other.
On a scale of 1-10, how would you rate your aesthetic appreciation of my breasts?
Go ahead, ogle my breasts. You aren't the first, and you won't be the last.

Would you like me to hold those for you, ~target~? I don't have anything else to be doing now.
If ever there was an objective for me to be capturing, that would surely be it.
Frankly, to have been hiding those from us this whole time should be a crime. If only my handcuffs were not still in my bedroom...
What are you-- you mean this bullet is off course?!
It is not your lucky day it seems, Joetta. Still, you must be used to this by now, if it's your profession!
I am ready to revive you!
I wasn't expecting nudity quite so soon, but I suppose this is something of a strange game... carry on, ~target~!
Take this as slowly as you need, ~target~.
I am sorry if my being so clothed makes this embarrassing for you, ~target~ -- perhaps I will lose the next round.
Don't tease us too much, ~name~.
Ah, the suspense... when you are ready, ~target~!
Time to show the doctor what you've got, ~name~...
With undergarments coming off, it's only a matter of time before one of us has to forfeit, ~target~... be careful.
Don't worry, ~target~ - anything anyone hadn't seen before, they've seen from me now.
Remember - all bodies are beautiful, yours especially.
Aah, ja... bitte...
Careful, ~target~... your losses are adding up...

You mean that bullet brushed your thigh and you...?
This thrill-seeking of yours will end with someone being seriously hurt, Aimee - of that I can be sure.
Ah, very impressive trickery, Joetta!
A-Amy? Are you... alright? (All the more like Dr. De Kuiper...)
Questionable judgment...
Whatever you're most comfortable with, I can't complain. Das ist mir Wurst.
If you feel up to it, you can give us a twirl - I'm sure that some of us would love to see how cute your hintern is.
I don't know about ~target~, but I personally find the sensation of air movement between my legs quite freeing.
I can't say I would have done the same myself, but the air will be good for you.
I am intimately familiar with human anatomy, but I can still forget its beauty...
It is almost like a flower bud, soon to bloom and spread wide open...
If you feel up to it, you can give us a twirl - I'm sure ~player~ would love to see how cute your hintern is.
I don't know about ~target~, but I personally find the sensation of air movement between my legs quite freeing.
Did you prepare for this game with exercises? Or is your rear naturally that good-looking?
A loss for you, ~target~, but certainly a win for us.
Schön...
At this point, wouldn't you have a better time joining me, ~target~?
Keep an eye on where you put those... I hear somebody's been collecting panties from the players they beat.
You can still try to win, ~target~! Don't give up just yet.
Ah, I have been meaning to say, the two of you make for a lovely couple! Seeing you in recordings is one thing, but it is quite another seeing you in person.
Oh, I can't believe I have not said something earlier! The two of you make for a lovely couple. I have seen you in recordings, but your chemistry is even more pronounced in person.
I hope this doesn't come across as rude of me to ask, Cat Noir, but is there a reason your lovely partner is not joining us to~background.time~?
I hope I'm not overstepping in asking, Cat Noir, but is there a reason your partner has not joined us for our game?
I hope this doesn't come across as rude of me to ask, Ladybug, but is there a reason your handsome partner is not joining us to~background.time~?
I hope I'm not overstepping in asking, Ladybug, but is there a reason your partner has not joined us for our game?
Marinette, you are in a relationship with Cat Noir, ja? Given the sexual nature of this game, you aren't doing this behind his back, I hope.

I am right in my understanding that you and Cat Noir are more than just crime-fighting partners, ja? Considering the sexual nature of this game, I hope you wouldn't be doing something like this without his agreement.
Kazuma, you say you turned yourself into a girl...? Impressive. May I ask how? I've looked into applying nanobiotics to sex reassignment, but... progress is slow.
If I may ask, Kazuma, how did you turn yourself into a girl...? If you could share your methods, it would be a great boon to the field of medicine.
Do you often come to small venues like this for promotional purposes, Ibuki?
You know, Ibuki, I think I'm beginning to see why Charlotte feels such a need to look after you, considering your attitude to risk.
Increasingly, I think I'm understanding Charlotte's point of view on you, Ibuki. You aren't often one to closely consider risks, are you?
You know, Ibuki, I'm beginning to get the sense that you're not often one to "look before you leap", as the saying goes.
Ibuki, would I be correct in thinking you aren't the one to do risk assessment within your band? There's a certain aura about you that makes me think not.
Ah, yes. It seemed inappropriate to comment on it, but there's only so much one can do to hide an injury like that.
Ibuki, don't you ever feel that with abilities like yours, you should be doing something more... meaningful?
Ibuki, you have some sort of cryokinetic ability, yes? So why is it that you wear that shirt with a flaming skull on it?
If it isn't too personal a question, Ibuki, just how did you acquire cryokinetic abilities? It seems like a power that could have countless medical applications.
Beatrix, am I correct in my understanding that your arm has an artificial intelligence embedded within it? Does that not... cause issues? For both you and it?

state.text:
You know, Beatrix, you remind me of an ex-coworker of mine.
I should clarify, that is not intended to be a compliment.

case.state: That's quite an interesting pattern around the waist of your dress, Fina. It seems almost reminiscent of a language, or perhaps circuitry. Does it have a deeper meaning?
Fina, if I remember correctly, you work alongside pirates, yes? I hope you'll forgive me for saying you don't quite resemble what I expect a pirate to look like.
Your talk of piratical life, Fina... I hope you don't find me rude for saying this, but you don't quite resemble what I would expect from a pirate.
Cynthia, you're a celebrity Pokémon trainer, no? What does that entail for your daily life? Is your work just training and waiting for challengers?
You're something of a celebrity in regards to Pokémon training, aren't you, Cynthia? What does that mean for your work? Do you just train and await challengers?
I must say, Jessie, I think of myself as a confident person, but I still can't imagine myself having the confidence your line of work. How do you get over that brand of stage fright?
I consider myself quite confident, Jessie, but even so, I can't imagine being self-assured enough for work like yours. Do you ever find yourself struggling with that at all?
I hope you don't find me too intrusive, Fina, but just what is the day-to-day life of a sky pirate like?
I hope you don't feel I'm asking too personal a question, Fina, but just what is it like, living as a sky pirate?

Fischl, the raven girl from the moon city, who commands the lightning with her bow. You almost seem as though you walked right out of a fairy tale, no? This place brings together the most unlikely people.
The raven girl from the moon city, who calls lightning from her bow... You seem almost like a character from a fairy tale, Fischl. This place truly seems to bring together all sorts of people.
Please, forgive my ignorance if my question is rude, Fischl, but... Just what is your companion? Oz, I think you call him? Is he some sort of... familiar? Does that make you a witch?
Forgive me if my ignorance seems rude, Fischl, but I'm intrigued by your... companion? The bird. Oz? Are you a witch, and he is your familiar?
Oh, Chihiro, welcome back! I suppose that means we won't have to find a way to have your AI strip.
I'm always pleased to encounter another scientist. What field do you work in, Heris?
Ah, another scientist? Wunderbar! What's your field of expertise, Heris?
I hope you don't feel put off by my presence, Hu Tao. Our roles may be somewhat oppositional, but I prefer to think of you being there for those I cannot help.
I hope you don't feel put out by my presence, Hu Tao. We may hold somewhat oppositional roles, but I like to think of you as one who catches those who slip through the cracks of the medical system.
I suppose I should be expecting to encounter magic users in a place as strange as this. What manner of magic do you work, Ahri?
In a place as strange as this, I suppose magic is no more unusual than the reaches of science I explore. What magic do you practice, Ahri?
I don't know if you're aware, but Overwatch likes to keep notes on all sorts of "people of interest". You may be pleased to know, Adrien, that you and your partner both appear on that list.
You may already be aware, but Overwatch keeps notes on some international "persons of interest". You may be pleased to know that you and your partner both feature in those files.
Tell me, Adrien, how do you enjoy your work as a model? I'm getting the sense you quite like being the center of attention, and models are never short on admirers.
So, Adrien, do you find your daily life as a model enjoyable? I get the sense you quite like attention, and models certainly get no shortage of that...
Do you find balancing a heroic identity with mundane life difficult, Marinette? It seems like quite a feat.
Do you struggle to find balance between your mundane and superheroic duties, Marinette? Managing two lives seems like a terribly difficult task.
Forgive me if I misunderstand, Aloy, but you come from a world ravaged by machines, yes? Do you know how it came to be that way?
Aloy, you come from a land where machines have destroyed the vast majority of modern civilization, ja? Do you know how that came to be the case?
As I understand it, Dorothy, you're some form of synthetic sex worker, correct?
Am I correct in my understanding that you are a synthetic sex worker, Dorothy?

If it's not too personal a topic, Dorothy, would you mind telling me about how Lilim are created? Are you capable of procreation? Is your mind inherently linked to your physical form, or do you exist as a replicable program?

If you don't mind my prying, Dorothy, could you tell me a bit about the creation of a new Lilim? Do you exist as a separate program and physical form, or are they immutably linked? Are Lilim capable of procreation?
What drew you to sex work, Dorothy? I hope that isn't too personal a question for you.
Was there something in particular that drew you to your current line of employment, Dorothy? You needn't answer if it's too personal a question.
I understand that you sing on stage, Eichi? I hope that isn't too severely impacted by your physical condition.
Am I right in understanding that you sing in stage performances, Eichi? I hope that your physical condition doesn't have too severe an impact on that.
It feel somewhat crude asking, but is there a significant difference providing sex work for humans versus other Lilim? Just how precise a simulacrum are your body designs?
Seeing as we're so open about your work, is there a significant difference between providing sex to a human versus another Lilim? How accurate to human biology are your bodies?
You're a veteran of Glitch City, Dorothy; do you have any recommendations as to the best places to visit? Even just where you like to go in your downtime.
You know your way around Glitch City, Dorothy; where would you recommend I explore if I were to visit? You must have some favorite spots to go when you're not working.
Robin, you're an archaeologist, ja? With your keen mind, it seems you could have chosen any field to specialize in, so what drew you to that one?
I understand you specialize in archaeology, Robin? What drew you to that? You seem to have quite the keen mind, so I assume it's not simple happenstance.
Aloy, just how is it that you hunt the mechanical beasts that you do? They're many times your size, ja? How do you overcome that?
You hunt beasts that are many times your size, and made of metal, and yet you still emerge victorious. How do you manage that, Aloy?
Ah, with your yo-yo gone, it seems rather like you'll have to expose either your face or your body, Ladybug. So... which will you be more protective of?
Well, Ladybug, it seems it's time to choose. Which comes off first? The mask, or the bodysuit? It seems like you'll be exposing more than you'd like either way...
That's a fine sword you have with you, Dunban. Not young, but very well cared for. The kind that has seen battle and emerged, not unscathed, but unbroken.

That seems like quite the weapon you have with you, Dunban. It looks like the kind of weapon that has seen battle and returned, bearing scars, but far from broken. The kind that isn't new any longer, but has been carefully cared for all the same.
Ah, I'm excited for the reveal of your gimmick! Though I must admit, the buildup has been quite amusing too.

Kora, I'm curious - what purpose do the glowing lines on your body serve? I'd initially assumed they were cosmetic, but if they don't vanish with your clothing, they must be more integral than that, ja?
You've piqued my curiosity, Kora. What purpose do your glowing lines serve? I'd assumed them to be cosmetic, but if they don't change when you remove clothing, that means they're important, ja?

If you wouldn't consider it rude, Trixie, may I ask you some questions on the matter of goblin physiology? I don't mean to pry, but this may be my only opportunity, so I'd like to make the most of it if I can.
With your consent, Trixie, may I ask you about goblin physiology? I understand that being inundated with medical inquiries probably isn't why you came here, but I'm afraid I'm rather curious.
What you do for your allies is very admirable, Darkness. Putting yourself in harm's way to protect another is the behavior of a true hero. I hope your allies appreciate what you do for them.
The lengths to which you go to protect your allies are very impressive, Darkness. It takes a real hero to stand strong in the path of danger, and I hope your allies realize that.
Ah, ~target~, I am sorry to see you be first to lose. Do not worry, I will not be telling any of our allies of what happened here.
I notice that even among the others I have encountered here, you have an especially exotic appearance, ~target~. Is looking like you do standard where you are from?
Ah, I just remembered! There was a phrase Hana told me was used to refer to body types like yours, ~target~! I believe it was... yes, short stack! Like pancakes! I think it is quite cute.
Ah, you have a very powerful build, ~target~. I am sure that had we had the option, we would have recruited you into Overwatch.
Well, it seems as though your time is up, ~target~. I do hope you aren't too disappointed by losing again to Overwatch - it is what you are used to by now, surely?
Oh, is that all from you, ~target~? That does make sense - you losing to Overwatch does seem to be one of your most practiced skills.
Am I right in understanding that you are some form of space-pirate, ~target~? That sounds like an exceedingly dangerous line of work.
The technology where I come from hasn't advanced to the point of common space travel, much less space piracy. You must have very eventful days.
From what I know of computer programming, it can get quite complicated. With how advanced the technology is where you are from, I can only imagine your skills are quite impressive, ~target~.
That armor of yours looks to have seen a good amount of use, ~target~. I hope it's done well protecting you.
On behalf of all medics, I would like to thank you for wearing your armor, ~target~. Our patients having a good source of protection makes our jobs vastly easier.
Ah, you make music, ~target~? What instruments do you use? Or do you use a mixing board? Lucio introduced me to them - he is a quite skilled musician himself.
Ah, ~target~, I understand that the rules now require that you masturbate. I hope your... ah... condition won't cause any issues with that.
Ah, ~target~... is this forfeit something you can participate in? I understand that your ongoing condition may cause issues regarding lubrication.
Is it really safe to play surrounded by so many weapons? I can't help but worry something might go wrong, especially if we have ~target~ bringing ~target.ifMale(his|her)~ own...
You know, ~target~, I have found that people seem to quite like witches. At least, they did when I dressed as one for Halloween. I was very popular that year.
Heroes never die, but they can lose.
I see you chose to arm yourself before coming here, ~target~. Did you really expect it would be so unsafe as to require you to bring weaponry?
Do you expect danger here, ~target~? I may have brought my Valkyrie suit, but weaponry seems a step further beyond pragmatic safety.
So you battle with these "Pokémon" of yours? I do hope you have a good recovery regimen for them...
Ah, it is always a pleasant surprise to encounter a fellow scientist at a game like this. I should like to hear about your research, if it isn't a terrible bother.
Another scientist, here of all places? It's a pleasure to meet you, ~target~. I should hope to get to hear about some of your research, if you have the inclination to share.
Oh, ~target~, I hope you don't find this game to be too intense for you. I would understand if you want to back out.
Are you sure this game is for you, ~target~? You seem to be quite shy. If you wanted to stop playing, I would entirely understand.
Ah, it is so lovely to be playing with someone as positive and cheerful as yourself, ~target~.
This seems to be game quite perfectly suited for you, ~target~. I can certainly understand the appeal, and I find your enthusiasm to be quite infectious.
You seem to have quite an enthusiasm for strip games, ~target~. I am beginning to get the sense you might be a veteran here, but not often a winner...
I notice that you don't talk much, ~target~. I hope that that isn't a matter of discomfort around us.
Oh, ~target~, you seem quite pale. I hope you get enough sun - a vitamin D deficiency can be quite problematic.
Oh, ~target~, you aren't having trouble with the rules, are you? I would be willing to help out, if you are.
Ah, I thought you were referring to the regular, four-legged variety. After all, ~pony~ is rather more anthropomorphic than any other horse.
Well, ~pony~ seems more human than horse to me. I was more expecting something akin to the talking gorilla I work alongside.
Oh! Well, I suppose I will try to keep an eye out for creatures like that.
So, there are... two Omnics, one called Aperture, and they are fighting over this facility where they trap humans for deadly tests? That is exceedingly worrying!
Oh, well that's good if it already poses no more threat! That gives me one less thing to worry about... wait, did you say it was going to explode? That sounds like a still-ongoing issue!
Don't think of this as being the "first loser" - think of it as being the "frontrunner in pleasure"!
~name~ again? For the sake of fairness, perhaps we should implement a rule to prevent someone from losing three times in a row again?
Three losses in a row? Your luck has really been quite poor, ~target~. I can only hope it improves from here.
I am no statistician, but so many losses in a row must be unusual, no?
You are not... purposefully losing, are you, ~target~? Because if not, this seems quite unusual.
Another loss for ~target~? While the streak is quite impressive, I'm not sure it's an achievement one should be seeking out...
Ah, ~target~, is it possible that your strategy for which cards to keep and which to return is... somewhat lacking? I only ask on account of your repeated losses.
I am no statistician, but so many losses in a row must be unusual, no?
You are not... purposefully losing, are you, ~target~? Because if not, this seems quite unusual.
Another loss for ~target~? While the streak is quite impressive, I'm not sure it's an achievement one should be seeking out...
Ah, ~target~, is it possible that your strategy for which cards to keep and which to return is... somewhat lacking? I only ask on account of your repeated losses.
You're our first stripper, ~name~. This is your chance to impress us.
Ah, ~target~, it seems you're up. This early, I would have no objection to your choosing something minor, if you so wish.
So early on, none of us could fault you for choosing something small if you wish, ~target~.
Don't feel pressured to be exposing yourself yet, ~target~, we've only just started. I suggest something small.
An early loss is a good opportunity to take off something small while we're all still warming up. If I were you, ~target~, I'd take that opportunity.
A loss early in the game calls for only a small removal, ~target~. You can do whatever you wish, of course, but that would be my inclination.
Much as I'd enjoy seeing you throw some spice into the game with something major early on, ~target~, it's probably wiser to go for something small.
Ah, of course! Please, continue - I can save any further comments for later.
Oh, my apologies! You two should continue, and I'll save any further comments for after you're done.
Oh, no, of course it isn't a problem. I was just curious. You should absolutely take a ~background.time~ off from saving the city when you need it.
It's not a problem at all, just a matter of curiosity. Taking time off when you need it is integral to maintaining your mental health.
I suppose there is good sense there - there's no crowd to advertise to, but this is more about building connections with notable people, yes?
There's nothing wrong with it, per se - it just seems an odd juxtaposition to me.
It shouldn't even require you to abandon your musical career - I have an ally who both serves as a protector of the people and a world-renowned electronic musician.
Yes, I'm quite starting to see that. Does that often get you into trouble?
I thought that might be the case. Do you often find yourself in difficult situations? I find that those traits tend to correlate quite strongly.
Well, I can certainly envisage cryotherapeutic applications, especially for precise tissue removal. Killing diseased or cancerous cells, for example.
Well, applications in cryotherapy aside, an ability like yours could certainly aid in the efficacy of transplant organ preservation and transport.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. Regardless of anything else, it's a lovely design, and I hope that you can at least carry on that particular Silvite tradition, regardless of anything else.
Ah, that's a pity. Still, if it is a connection to Silvites that you wish to keep, I encourage you to maintain at least that one fashion tradition. It's a lovely design, after all.
That's a sensible reason to not seem a pirate if ever there was one. I hope you don't consider me a hypocrite in asking. I'm sure I'm not what you'd expect a doctor to look like either.
Well, I suppose that does make it more reasonable. I hope you don't think me hypocritical in asking, considering my own style of dress is far removed from the typical doctor.
Fending off sky creatures may be unglamorous for you, but it's an area I know very little of. What manner of monsters do you encounter in the skies?
I suppose there must be treasure for the taking if there are sky pirates. Is it simple wealth, generally? Or do the ruins hold archaeological treasure too?
Are there often discoveries to be made in the sky? I'd expect things to be more readily visible without the sea to block your vision, but I assume that must not be the case.
So these discoveries, you seek them in exchange for gold? What manner of treasures are people so willing to pay for?

Ah, yes. Battles against intelligent opponents are often more challenging. A weak force, when deployed with cunning, can be more fearsome than an opponent of greater strength. Are there many pirates in the skies you sail?
I completely understand. Intelligent foes pose greater tactical threat, but the sheer force of individual monsters is nothing to scoff at, I'm sure. What varieties of monster do you often encounter?
Ah, so you handle administrative work for the Pokémon League at large as well? I must admit, the workings of such a widespread organization are quite beyond me.
So there's administrative work for the Pokémon League as well as your public-facing appearances. I admit, the workings of an organization as large as the League are a bit beyond me.
Now, yes, but what about when you first began working in your field? Wasn't there a level of trepidation then?
Perhaps that's the case now, but what about when you were first beginning your current line of work? Wasn't there a part of you that worried how it would be received?
Oh! So... you are not a witch, but you choose to appear similar to one. Much like my own relationship to an angel, no?
Ah, I think I understand. You are not truly a witch, but you choose to appear like one? In a manner similar to my appearance as an angel, perhaps?
Ah, of course! I'd love to hear about your local fair tales! I have something of a soft spot for them.
That sounds wonderful! I have something of a soft spot for little fairy tales, so I'd be happy to hear about any that you are willing to share.

I should hate to live in any universe desperate enough to need you to become its savior. I'd welcome the Dräckssau who perverted my work into a weapon back into my lab before I'd praise a monster like you.
I would normally be the last person to judge you for speaking to your work like a child, but that is both an AI and a weapon. It should not be infantalized.
I'm afraid I prefer my partners a little more mature... but that doesn't keep me from an occasional exception. Are sex-working androids common where you come from?
I'm afraid I tend to prefer more mature partners, Dorothy... but I do make the occasional exception. Tell me, is yours a common role for androids, where you come from?
Intriguing. Your world sounds similar to what may have come about had Overwatch not succeeded in deactivating the Omniums. I'm very sorry to hear that.
Curiouser and curiouser. Self-replicating machines are exactly what Overwatch was formed to combat. I'm sorry to hear that your world was not as successful in stopping them as mine.
I'm sorry you have to deal with such a thing. I had the mixed blessing of having nobody to protect when I took on the role of Mercy, so I never had to hide my identity.
It certainly seems challenging. I had no ties left to need protecting when I donned the Valkyrie suit, so I've never had to consider balancing two separate identities.
That's a very impressive strategy for dealing with your disability. You should be proud, Eichi, not everyone could overcome an obstacle like that.
What a novel way to work around the limits imposed by your disability. That's exceptionally resourceful of you, Eichi. You should feel proud.
Fascinating only begins to cover it! If you're capable of sex, but don't use it for reproduction, then how is a new Lilim made?
Fascinating is exactly the word I was going to use myself! So, if you're built to be capable of sex, but don't use it for reproduction, then how is a new Lilim created?
Well, I can hardly blame you for taking advantage of your ability to fill an empty niche in the market. Were there many other professions you considered?
Of course, taking advantage of a niche that's open only to you is a perfectly sensible decision. Were there many other professions you considered before settling on your current one?
Oh? And she's in favor of you... "playing" in a place like this?
Is that so? I hope she's aware of just what kinds of places her cat is "playing" when she isn't around to see him.

You should hardly be surprised. Your work in saving Paris from threat after threat is nothing short of spectacular, and Overwatch wouldn't be a very good security organization if we didn't notice that.
It shouldn't be that much of a surprise. You've kept Paris safe through countless disasters. Frankly, if we didn't notice you, we'd be a failure as a security organization.

Oh, I'm sorry to hear it started for so negative reasons. I'm well aware of how painful it can be to fill a role you never wished for. But if you've reclaimed it, then you understand the power that comes with making it your own.

Oh! I'm sorry you had to go through so long a time with fame you didn't wish for. Believe me, I can understand that. But I also understand the power in reclaiming the role that controlled you and making it your own.
Oho? Well, I certainly didn't expect this! What a spectacle!
Oh? That was very impressive to witness! I certainly didn't expect so significant a transformation.
A sacrifice made for the greater good, and protection of your people. Honorable, but painful. I can understand that.
Ah! Adrien, you are- oh, I see, it is transformation magic. Always so flashy and dangerous-looking...
Careful, you are- ah, you are magically transforming. Never mind, no need to worry, I think.
Oh! That was... rather abrupt. Poor girl...
The truth? Well, I suppose this is as good a time as any...
There is little I wouldn't give to have the protection of Hana's defense matrix right now...
Perhaps I should talk to Brigitte or Winston about getting a shield installed in my armor...
I suppose I will just have to stay perfectly still... and get ready to treat bullet wounds...

Although, I'm not entirely sure what kind of gimmick would require exposing--
Ah! That... quite thoroughly answers my questions.
Oh! Well, that's quite a novel way to undress.
Well, I get the sense you aren't much of a talker, Chell, but if you do want to talk about it, or not talk about it and get a drink, then you can just let me know.
Ah, ~target~... you are wearing a school uniform, yes? Aren't you supposed to be in school at the moment?
Oh, ~target~, you seem as though you are familiar with video games. Do you know why the commenters on Hana's streams refer to me as a... I believe the term is heal slot?
Ah, ~target~, you are a student? What sort of institution do you attend?
Ah, if this distresses you, ~target~, perhaps you can pretend this is a routine medical checkup? I am a doctor, after all.
Have you tried breathing exercises, ~target~? Close your eyes, and breathe slow, deep breaths. I find it helps to keep me calm.
I'm not sure how much I can truly do to help with anxiety you might feel over stripping, ~target~, but I can assure you that none of us are here to mock you, only to enjoy ourselves.
Ah, if this distresses you, ~target~, perhaps you can pretend this is a routine medical checkup? I am a doctor, after all.
Have you tried breathing exercises, ~target~? Close your eyes, and breathe slow, deep breaths. I find it helps to keep me calm.
I'm not sure how much I can truly do to help with anxiety you might feel over stripping, ~target~, but I can assure you that none of us are here to mock you, only to enjoy ourselves.
Come to think of it... there have been scientists who weren't altogether above board. You do subscribe to ethical guidelines, don't you, ~target~?
Although... I have in the past encountered those who considered themselves scientists without caring at all for ethics. You wouldn't number among those like that, would you, ~target~?
It is good to see I was not the only one to come over-prepared with protection. Of a combat-based nature, I mean. Though it is also wise to carry sexual protection.

Ah, I should have thought to bring my glasses like you did, ~target~! I wore my contact lenses today instead.
Ah well, one layer will not make too much difference.
That's quite a lavish outfit you have on, ~target~. Did you just come from a formal event?
I hope those heels are not uncomfortably high for you, ~target~. They can be all too easy to fall in, especially if you are not used to them.
Ooh, ~target~, that underwear is certainly extravagant. I hope you did not feel you had to dress up for an event like this. This is just supposed to be for fun, after all.
Why is it that you wear that mask, ~target~? Do you have an identity to hide? This may be the wrong place for that.
It seems you intend to be playing dangerously, ~target~. I can respect that, but I will ask that you try not to be surprised if I beat you.
~target~... you do understand that this is strip poker, don't you? Did you not consider wearing more layers?
